detailed_translations.english: the act or ceremony of putting a dead body into a grave

sentences.english: The funeral will be held at St. Martin’s Church.
sentences.chinese: 葬礼将在圣马丁教堂举行。

sentences.english: Hundreds of mourners attended the funeral of the two boys.
sentences.chinese: 数百名哀悼者参加了那两个男孩的葬礼。

sentences.english: the minister who conducted the funeral service
sentences.chinese: 主持葬礼的牧师

sentences.english: Nelson’s funeral procession down the Thames
sentences.chinese: 沿泰晤士河而下为纳尔逊送葬的队伍

sentences.english: Ramdas set fire to the funeral pyre .
sentences.chinese: 拉姆达斯点燃了火葬柴堆。

detailed_translations.english: a religious ceremony for burying or cremating someone who has died

sentences.english: Whether the legend is true or not, the discovery of coffee dates back to 800 A.D. when Africans created a coffee-berry pulp.
sentences.chinese: 不论这个传说是真是假，咖啡的发现要回溯到公元800年，那时非洲人制造出了一种咖啡浆果浆。

detailed_translations.english: a small soft fruit with small seeds

sentences.english: He commanded his men to retreat.
sentences.chinese: 他命令手下撤退。

sentences.english: He commands the 4th Battalion.
sentences.chinese: 他指挥第四营。

sentences.english: the power and finances commanded by the police
sentences.chinese: 警方掌握的权力和资金

detailed_translations.english: (of sb in a position of authority) to tell sb to do sth

sentences.english: We’ve decided to stain the shelves blue.
sentences.chinese: 我们决定把架子涂成蓝色。

detailed_translations.english: to change the colour of something, especially something made of wood, by using a special liquid
a mark that is difficult to remove, especially one made by a liquid such as blood, coffee, or ink

sentences.english: Nothing I did would ever satisfy my father.
sentences.chinese: 我做什么都不能让父亲满意。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel pleased by doing what they want

sentences.english: She got great satisfaction from helping people to learn.
sentences.chinese: 她在帮助人们学习的过程中得到很大的满足。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of happiness or pleasure because you have achieved something or got what you wanted

sentences.english: The hotel has everything you could possibly desire .
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店里你想要的东西应有尽有。

sentences.english: Add lemon juice if desired .
sentences.chinese: 需要的话加点柠檬汁。

detailed_translations.english: to want something very much
a strong hope or wish

sentences.english: She gave me an anxious look.
sentences.chinese: 她焦急地看了我一眼。

sentences.english: He seemed most anxious to speak to me alone.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎迫切地想同我单独谈谈。

detailed_translations.english: causing anxiety; showing anxiety

sentences.english: He’s a bright kid and eager to learn.
sentences.chinese: 他是个聪明的孩子，热爱学习。

sentences.english: She’s a very hard worker and very eager to please.
sentences.chinese: 她工作很卖力，而且很希望别人满意。

sentences.english: A crowd of eager young students were already waiting outside.
sentences.chinese: 一群急不可待的青年学生已经在外面等着。

detailed_translations.english: very keen and excited about something that is going to happen or about something you want to do

sentences.english: Children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult.
sentences.chinese: 14岁以下儿童必须有成人陪同。

sentences.english: Wherever her husband went, she would accompany him.
sentences.chinese: 不论丈夫去哪里，她都陪伴左右。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陪同， 伴随； 为…伴奏
detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere with someone

sentences.english: Electric cables are buried beneath the streets.
sentences.chinese: 电缆埋在街道的下面。

detailed_translations.english: to put someone who has died in a  grave

detailed_translations.chinese: (Bury)人名；(法)比里；(英、西)伯里；(德、意、罗、波、捷、匈)布里；(俄)布雷

sentences.english: a 55 mph speed limit
sentences.chinese: 55英里的时速限制

sentences.english: The public is not allowed within a 2-mile limit of the missile site.
sentences.chinese: 众不得进入导弹发射场两英里范围内。

detailed_translations.english: the greatest or least amount, number, speed etc that is allowed

sentences.english: a nuclear limitation treaty
sentences.chinese: 核限制条约

detailed_translations.chinese: 限制， 限度； 局限
detailed_translations.english: the act or process of controlling or reducing something

sentences.english: Belinda greeted her warmly.
sentences.chinese: 贝琳达热情地招呼她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 欢迎，迎接；致敬，致意；映入眼帘

sentences.english: I smiled a polite greeting, but the woman hardly acknowledged me.
sentences.chinese: 我客气地笑着打了个招呼，可是那女人没有答理我。

sentences.english: The two cousins exchanged greetings (= greeted each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 表兄妹俩互相问候。

detailed_translations.english: something you say or do when you meet someone

sentences.english: Could you do me a favour and tell Kelly I can’t make it?
sentences.chinese: 你帮个忙告诉凯莉说我来不了好吗？

sentences.english: He hired John as a favour to his father.
sentences.chinese: 他雇约翰是给他父亲一个面子。

sentences.english: Paul, can I ask you a favor ?
sentences.chinese: 保罗，能帮我一下吗？

sentences.english: I owed him a favour so I couldn’t say no.
sentences.chinese: 我欠他一个人情，所以无法拒绝。

sentences.english: She helps me out when I have too much to do, and I return the favour when I can.
sentences.chinese: 我忙的时候她来帮忙，我能帮她的时候就还她人情。

sentences.english: Do yourself a favour and make sure you get some time to yourself.
sentences.chinese: 对自己好些，一定要留点时间给自己。

detailed_translations.english: something that you do for someone in order to help them or be kind to them

detailed_translations.chinese: 赞同； 喜爱， 偏爱； 有利于
detailed_translations.english: to provide suitable conditions for something to happen

sentences.english: ice cream in plastic containers
sentences.chinese: 塑料容器里的冰激凌

sentences.english: a container ship
sentences.chinese: 集装箱船

detailed_translations.english: something such as a box or bowl that you use to keep things in

sentences.english: I handled most of the paperwork.
sentences.chinese: 大部分文书工作是我做的。

sentences.english: The case is being handled by a top lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 此案正由一位顶尖律师负责处理。

sentences.english: The finance department handles all the accounts.
sentences.chinese: 财务部处理所有账目。

sentences.english: Computers can handle huge amounts of data.
sentences.chinese: 计算机能处理大量数据。

detailed_translations.english: to do the things that are necessary to complete a job

sentences.english: She treats me like one of the family.
sentences.chinese: 她把我当作家人看待。

sentences.english: sewage treated so that it can be used as fertilizer
sentences.chinese: 经过处理可用作肥料的污水

sentences.english: Let's go out for lunch─ my treat (= I will pay) .
sentences.chinese: 咱们到外面去吃午餐，我请客。

detailed_translations.english: to behave towards someone or something in a particular way
something special that you give someone or do for them because you know they will enjoy it

sentences.english: There have been great advances in the treatment of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 癌症治疗有了很大的进展。

sentences.english: Just lately, Kyra has been giving me the silent treatment (= refusing to speak to me because she is angry with me ) .
sentences.chinese: 就在最近，凯拉一直对我不理不睬。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done to cure someone who is injured or ill

sentences.english: a four-bedroom house
sentences.chinese: 一幢有四间卧室的房子

sentences.english: America’s oldest publishing house
sentences.chinese: 美国历史最悠久的出版社

sentences.english: a small independent software house
sentences.chinese: 一家小型的独立软件公司

sentences.english: an auction house
sentences.chinese: 一家拍卖行

sentences.english: a famous Italian fashion house
sentences.chinese: 一家著名的意大利时装公司

detailed_translations.english: a building that someone lives in, especially one that has more than one level and is intended to be used by one family

sentences.english: Police had to be called in to control the crowds.
sentences.chinese: 只好调来警察控制人群。

sentences.english: He controlled the urge to laugh.
sentences.chinese: 他克制住笑的冲动。

sentences.english: The disease robs you of muscle control.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病会让你丧失肌肉控制力。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something do what you want, or make something happen in the way that you want
the ability or power to make someone or something do what you want or make something happen in the way you want

sentences.english: His career has been hindered by injury.
sentences.chinese: 由于受伤，他的事业受到了阻碍。

sentences.english: policies that will hinder rather than help families
sentences.chinese: 对家庭有害无益的政策

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for something to develop or succeed

sentences.english: A degree is more of a hindrance than a help in British industry.
sentences.chinese: 在英国工业界，学位反倒是个累赘。

detailed_translations.english: something or someone that makes it difficult for you to do something

sentences.english: They live near London.
sentences.chinese: 他们住在伦敦附近。

sentences.english: I’m sure they live somewhere near here.
sentences.chinese: 我肯定他们就住在这附近。

sentences.english: They moved house to be nearer the school.
sentences.chinese: 他们把家搬到离学校近一些。

sentences.english: She told the children not to go near the canal.
sentences.chinese: 她告诉孩子们不要走近运河。

sentences.english: I’m warning you - don’t come any nearer!
sentences.chinese: 我警告你别再靠近！

sentences.english: We heard voices as we drew near the village.
sentences.chinese: 我们走近村子时听见了说话声。

detailed_translations.english: only a short distance from a person or thing
only a short distance away from someone or something

sentences.english: Both Helen’s parents are doctors.
sentences.chinese: 海伦的父母都是医生。

detailed_translations.english: used to talk about two people, things etc together, and emphasize that each is included

sentences.english: Please enclose a cheque with your order.
sentences.chinese: 请随订单附上支票。

sentences.english: The pool area is enclosed by a six-foot wall.
sentences.chinese: 游泳区用六英尺高的高墙围了起来。

detailed_translations.english: to put something inside an envelope as well as a letter

sentences.english: a young boy with skinny legs
sentences.chinese: 双腿干瘦的小男孩

sentences.english: She fell and broke her leg.
sentences.chinese: 她摔断了腿。

detailed_translations.english: one of the long parts of your body that your feet are joined to, or a similar part on an animal or insect

sentences.english: It took nearly two hours to get here.
sentences.chinese: 到这里花了将近两小时。

sentences.english: Michelle’s nearly twenty.
sentences.chinese: 米歇尔年近二十。

sentences.english: Is the job nearly finished?
sentences.chinese: 这工作快干完了吗？

sentences.english: Louise is nearly as tall as her mother.
sentences.chinese: 路易丝差不多和她母亲一样高。

sentences.english: I nearly always go home for lunch.
sentences.chinese: 我几乎总是回家吃午饭。

sentences.english: He very nearly died.
sentences.chinese: 他差点送命。

detailed_translations.english: almost, but not quite or not completely

sentences.english: Steve borrowed his dad’s sports car to impress his girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫借来他爸爸的跑车向女友炫耀。

detailed_translations.english: to press something into a soft surface so that a mark or pattern appears on it

sentences.english: He pushed his half-eaten salad aside and left.
sentences.chinese: 他推开吃了一半的色拉走了。

sentences.english: He stepped aside to let Katherine go in first.
sentences.chinese: 他站到一边让凯瑟琳先进去。

sentences.english: Mark drew me aside and explained the problem.
sentences.chinese: 马克把我拉到一边给我解释这个问题。

sentences.english: She swept her thick hair aside.
sentences.chinese: 她把浓密的头发梳到一边。

detailed_translations.english: moved to one side or away from you

sentences.english: Many countries, for example Mexico and Japan, have a lot of earthquakes.
sentences.chinese: 许多国家，例如墨西哥和日本，经常发生地震。

sentences.english: Her courage is an example to us all.
sentences.chinese: 她的勇气是我们大家的榜样。

detailed_translations.english: something such as an object, a fact or a situation that shows, explains or supports what you say

sentences.english: We would like to get better acquainted.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望加深对彼此的了解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 熟识的；知晓的；有知识的
detailed_translations.english: if you are acquainted with someone, you have met them a few times but do not know them very well

sentences.english: Several senators introduced legislation aimed at sexual harassment.
sentences.chinese: 几位参议员提交了针对性骚扰的立法议案。

detailed_translations.english: to formally present a possible new law to be discussed

sentences.english: The King was clothed in a purple gown.
sentences.chinese: 国王身穿紫袍。

detailed_translations.english: to put clothes on your body

sentences.english: basic necessities such as food and clothing
sentences.chinese: 食物和衣服这类基本的生活必需品

sentences.english: She took only a few items of clothing.
sentences.chinese: 她只带了几件衣服。

detailed_translations.english: the clothes that people wear

sentences.english: Nobody insults my family and gets away with it!
sentences.chinese: 谁也别想侮辱了我的家人之后就这么算了！

sentences.english: I hope Andy won’t be insulted if I don’t come.
sentences.chinese: 如果我不来，希望安迪不要介意。

sentences.english: 200 for all that work? It’s an insult.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：干那么多工作才给200美元？这简直是侮辱。

detailed_translations.english: to offend someone by saying or doing something they think is rude
a remark or action that is offensive or deliberately rude

sentences.english: His remarks deeply offended many Scottish people.
sentences.chinese: 他的话严重冒犯了许多苏格兰人。

sentences.english: The careful language is designed not to offend.
sentences.chinese: 使用谨慎的语言是为了不得罪人。

sentences.english: In Western countries girls are far less likely to offend than boys.
sentences.chinese: 在西方国家，女孩们远不像男孩们那样容易犯罪。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone angry or upset by doing or saying something that they think is rude, unkind etc
to commit a crime or crimes

sentences.english: His solicitor said he committed the offence because he was heavily in debt.
sentences.chinese: 他的律师说他犯罪是因为欠下巨债。

detailed_translations.english: an illegal action or a crime

sentences.english: Better street lighting might help to reduce crime.
sentences.chinese: 改善街道照明或许有助于减少犯罪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 照明； 照明设备； 光线
detailed_translations.english: the lights that light a room, building, or street, or the quality of the light produced

sentences.english: I remember watching one of my tapes from 1991 when I went to Belgium and looked at myself speaking English.
sentences.chinese: 我记得我看过一盘我1991年的录像带，那时我刚到比利时，我看着我自己说英语的样子。

sentences.english: Someone once said: ‘beauty is in the eye of the beer holder’; if that’s the case, then Belgium is exquisite.
sentences.chinese: 有人曾经说过：“在手持啤酒的人眼中美丽无处不在。” 如果真的是这样，那么比利时就美艳至极了。

sentences.english: That is greater than the GDP of Belgium and Sweden.
sentences.chinese: 这超过了比利时和瑞典两国的国民收入。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比利时（西欧国家，首都布鲁塞尔Brussels）

sentences.english: Hilary was popular at school.
sentences.chinese: 希拉里在学校里很受欢迎。

sentences.english: a popular holiday resort
sentences.chinese: 人们喜欢的度假胜地

sentences.english: Coffee is probably the most popular drink in the world.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡很可能是世界上最受欢迎的饮料。

sentences.english: a popular movement for democracy
sentences.chinese: 争取民主的全民运动

detailed_translations.english: liked by a lot of people

sentences.english: The president’s popularity has declined considerably.
sentences.chinese: 总统的支持率大大下降了。

detailed_translations.english: when something or someone is liked or supported by a lot of people

sentences.english: The nation’s fuel supplies will not last forever.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家的燃料供应不会无穷无尽。

sentences.english: To protect the food supply , the government ordered the slaughter of affected cattle.
sentences.chinese: 为保护食品供应，政府下令宰杀被感染的牛。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of something that is available to be used

sentences.english: In Finland purists insist that only birch bark should be added.
sentences.chinese: 在芬兰，纯化论者坚持说只能加白桦树皮。

sentences.english: Cork bark is closely intertwined with the lives of the people in these regions.
sentences.chinese: 软木橡树的树皮与这些地方的百姓生活密切地交织在一起。

sentences.english: In his workshop, a Kakunodate craftsman prepares the cherry bark before applying this as a veneer to a range of objects.
sentences.chinese: 在将这种工艺作为一系列物体的单板运用之前，角馆的工匠在自己的作坊准备樱花树皮。

detailed_translations.english: the outer covering of a tree

sentences.english: The school has a system of rewards and punishments to encourage good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 学校有奖惩制度以鼓励良好行为。

sentences.english: The club’s directors rewarded him with a free season ticket.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部的董事们奖给他一张免费季票。

detailed_translations.english: something that you get because you have done something good or helpful or have worked hard
to give something to someone because they have done something good or helpful or have worked fo

sentences.english: The fair attracted hundreds of people from the neighbouring towns and villages.
sentences.chinese: 集市吸引了邻近城镇及村庄的好几百人前来。

detailed_translations.english: near the place where you are or the place you are talking about

sentences.english: It is important to reward good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 表现好要给予奖励，这是很重要的。

detailed_translations.english: the things that a person or animal does

sentences.english: You should be ashamed of your bad manners.
sentences.chinese: 你应该对自己的不礼貌感到羞耻。

sentences.english: I really envy you and Ian, you seem so happy together.
sentences.chinese: 我真是羡慕你和伊恩，你俩在一起看起来多幸福。

sentences.english: She has a lifestyle which most people would envy.
sentences.chinese: 她的生活方式会令大多数人感到羡慕。

sentences.english: She could see that all the other girls were green with envy(= feeling a lot of envy ).
sentences.chinese: 她看得出其他女孩都很眼红。

detailed_translations.english: to wish that you had someone else’s possessions, abilities etc
the feeling of wanting something that someone else has

sentences.english: Her name is Mandy Wilson.
sentences.chinese: 她的名字是曼迪•威尔逊。

sentences.english: What’s your name?
sentences.chinese: 你叫什么名字？

sentences.english: He didn’t want to do anything to damage the good name of the company.
sentences.chinese: 他不想做任何有损公司良好声誉的事。

sentences.english: They’re a lot better than some airlines I could name.
sentences.chinese: 他们比我叫得上名字的一些航空公司要好得多。

detailed_translations.english: what someone is called
to say what the name of someone or something is, especially officially

sentences.english: All consultations are by appointment only.
sentences.chinese: 就诊必须预约。

sentences.english: Other changes included the appointment of a new Foreign Minister.
sentences.chinese: 其他变动包括任命了一位新的外交部长。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement for a meeting at an agreed time and place, for a particular purpose

sentences.english: unleaded petrol
sentences.chinese: 无铅汽油

sentences.english: petrol prices
sentences.chinese: 汽油价格

sentences.english: The petrol tank is leaking.
sentences.chinese: 油箱漏了。

detailed_translations.english: a liquid obtained from  petroleum that is used to supply power to the engine of cars and other vehicles

sentences.english: hydrogen gas
sentences.chinese: 氢气

sentences.english: Can you light the gas for me?
sentences.chinese: 你帮我点燃煤气好吗？

sentences.english: I probably spend over 200 a month on gas.
sentences.chinese: 我一个月大概要花200多美元汽油钱。

detailed_translations.english: a substance such as air, which is not solid or liquid, and usually cannot be seen

sentences.english: Scientists have observed a drop in ozone levels over the Antarctic.
sentences.chinese: 科学家已经观察到南极洲上方的臭氧浓度有所下降。

sentences.english: Predators have been observed to avoid attacking brightly coloured species.
sentences.chinese: 据观察发现，食肉动物会避免袭击色彩鲜艳的物种。

sentences.english: The army was observing a ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 军队当时在遵守一项停火协议。

sentences.english: ‘Sid looks ill,’ Doherty observed.
sentences.chinese: “锡德看上去病了。”多尔蒂说道。

detailed_translations.english: to see and notice something

sentences.english: Darwin’s observations on the habits of certain birds
sentences.chinese: 达尔文对某些鸟类习性的论述

sentences.english: Paz makes some observations about the role of the critic.
sentences.chinese: 帕斯论述了评论家的作用。

detailed_translations.english: a spoken or written remark about something you have noticed

sentences.english: The bed wasn’t particularly comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 这床不大舒服。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel physically relaxed, without any pain or without being too hot, cold etc

sentences.english: I dress for comfort, not fashion.
sentences.chinese: 我穿衣服只讲舒服，不追求时髦。

sentences.english: Alan was very reluctant to leave the warmth and comfort of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦很不情愿离开暖和舒适的火堆。

sentences.english: Now you can watch your favorite movies in the comfort of your own home.
sentences.chinese: 现在你可以舒舒服服地在自己家里看你最喜欢的电影了。

sentences.english: Whenever he was upset, he would turn to her for comfort and advice.
sentences.chinese: 他每当心烦意乱时，就会去向她寻求安慰和建议。

sentences.english: He longed to take her in his arms and comfort her.
sentences.chinese: 他很想把她搂在怀里安慰她。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being physically relaxed and satisfied, so that nothing is hurting you, making you feel too hot or cold etc
to make someone feel less worried, unhappy, or upset, for example by saying kind things to them or touching them

sentences.english: She needed someone to advise her.
sentences.chinese: 她需要有个人给她出主意。

sentences.english: ‘Make sure that you keep the documents in a safe place,’ Otley advised him.
sentences.chinese: “一定要把文件放在安全的地方。”奥特利向他建议道。

sentences.english: Keep us advised of (= continue to tell us about ) any new developments.
sentences.chinese: 请随时告诉我们任何新的进展情况。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone what you think they should do, especially when you know more than they do about something

sentences.english: They killed four policemen while robbing a bank.
sentences.chinese: 他们抢劫一家银行的时候杀了4名警察。

sentences.english: A 77-year-old woman was robbed at knifepoint.
sentences.chinese: 一名77岁老妪遭到持刀抢劫。

detailed_translations.english: to steal money or property from a person, bank etc

sentences.english: Northbridge is a cool, calculating, and clever criminal who could strike again.
sentences.chinese: 诺思布里奇是个冷静、精明、机灵的罪犯，他有可能再犯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算的；深谋远虑的；审慎的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone as calculating, you disapprove of the fact that they deliberately plan to get what they want, often by hurting or harming other people

sentences.english: Cathy did a rough calculation.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜作了一个粗略的计算。

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of using numbers to find out an amount

sentences.english: Come on. Aren’t you ready yet?
sentences.chinese: 快点，你还没准备好吗？

sentences.english: When the doorbell rang he was ready and waiting .
sentences.chinese: 门铃响的时候，他已经准备好在等着了。

sentences.english: Why does it take you so long to get ready to go out?
sentences.chinese: 你外出怎么要准备那么长时间？

sentences.english: He's always ready to help his friends.
sentences.chinese: 他总是乐意帮助朋友。

detailed_translations.english: fully prepared for what you are going to do

sentences.english: the highest mountain in Austria
sentences.chinese: 奥地利最高的山

sentences.english: the Rocky Mountains
sentences.chinese: 落基山脉

sentences.english: a steep mountain road
sentences.chinese: 陡峭的山路

sentences.english: magnificent mountain ranges
sentences.chinese: 雄伟的山脉

sentences.english: snow-capped mountain peaks
sentences.chinese: 白雪覆盖的山峰

sentences.english: a mountain rescue team
sentences.chinese: 山地营救队

sentences.english: She was the first British woman to climb the mountain .
sentences.chinese: 她是攀登这座山峰的第一位英国女子。

detailed_translations.english: a very high hill

sentences.english: Therefore, we should be more like a miner to stand in reality, excavate off wastes, and get gold mines.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们更应该像一个矿工一样为执著于现实，挖开渣滓，淘出金矿。

sentences.english: From the standpoint of know-how the only difference between the miner of graphite in Ceylon and the logger in Oregon is in the type of know-how.
sentences.chinese: 从知道者的立场来看所谓的知道之间的不同不过是锡兰的矿工之于石墨和俄勒冈的伐木工人之间在某一类别的知道而已。

sentences.english: A miner bought food from a makeshift shop set up in the trunk of a car near a roadblock by striking miners.
sentences.chinese: 一位矿工从搭建在车厢中的临时食品店中购买食物，附近的道路都被罢工的矿工们设置了路障。

detailed_translations.english: someone who works under the ground in a mine to remove coal, gold etc

sentences.english: It was Glen’s idea, not mine.
sentences.chinese: 这是格伦的主意，不是我的。

sentences.english: ‘Is that your car?’ ‘No, mine is parked over the road.’
sentences.chinese: “那是你的车吗？”“不是，我的车停在路对面。”

sentences.english: You’ve got good legs – mine are too thin.
sentences.chinese: 你的腿很美——我的腿太细了。

sentences.english: His English is better than mine.
sentences.chinese: 他英语比我好。

detailed_translations.english: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with himself or herself

sentences.english: This is Gavin Williams, reporting from the United Nations in New York.
sentences.chinese: 我是加文·威廉斯，在纽约联合国总部为您报道。

sentences.english: We aim to report the news as fairly as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们力求公正地报道这一新闻。

sentences.english: The incident was widely reported in the national press.
sentences.chinese: 这一事件在全国的媒体上被广泛报道。

detailed_translations.english: to give people information about recent events, especially in newspapers and on television and radio

sentences.english: Please state your name, address and occupation.
sentences.chinese: 请写明你的姓名、地址和职业。

sentences.english: professional and managerial occupations
sentences.chinese: 专业及管理工作

sentences.english: manual occupations
sentences.chinese: 体力工作

sentences.english: the German occupation of France
sentences.chinese: 德军对法国的占领

detailed_translations.english: a job or profession

sentences.english: people who work in the professions
sentences.chinese: 从事专业性工作的人

sentences.english: nurses, social workers, and other people in the caring professions
sentences.chinese: 护士、社工和其他从事护理行业的人

detailed_translations.english: a job that needs a high level of education and training

sentences.english: What professional qualifications does he have?
sentences.chinese: 他有哪些专业资格？

sentences.english: You may need to seek professional help.
sentences.chinese: 你可能需要寻求专业帮助。

sentences.english: the terms that doctors and other health professionals use
sentences.chinese: 医师和其他保健专业人员使用的术语

detailed_translations.english: relating to a job that needs special education and training
someone who works in a job that needs special education and training, such as a doctor, lawyer, or architect

sentences.english: Calm down for a minute and listen to me.
sentences.chinese: 冷静一下，听我说。

sentences.english: I'll try a herbal remedy to calm him down.
sentences.chinese: 我会尝试用一种香草疗法使他平静下来。

detailed_translations.english: If you calm down, or if someone calms you down, you become less angry, upset, or excited

sentences.english: a famous actor
sentences.chinese: 著名演员

sentences.english: Many famous people have stayed in the hotel.
sentences.chinese: 许多名人都曾下榻这家酒店。

sentences.english: The Eiffel Tower is a famous landmark (= a famous place or building that is easy to recognize ) .
sentences.chinese: 埃菲尔铁塔是著名的地标。

sentences.english: Da Vinci’s world-famous portrait of the Mona Lisa
sentences.chinese: 达•芬奇的那幅闻名世界的肖像画《蒙娜丽莎》

detailed_translations.english: known about by many people in many places

sentences.english: She reached out to touch his arm.
sentences.chinese: 她伸手去碰他的胳膊。

sentences.english: If your house has been burgled, you shouldn’t touch anything until the police arrive.
sentences.chinese: 如果家中被盗，在警察赶到之前不要动任何物品。

sentences.english: ‘Don’t touch me!’ she yelled.
sentences.chinese: “别碰我！”她大叫道。

sentences.english: Her plight has touched the hearts of people around the world.
sentences.chinese: 她的困境触动了全世界人的心弦。

sentences.english: She felt a gentle touch on her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 她感到有人轻轻碰了一下她的肩膀。

detailed_translations.english: to put your hand, finger etc on someone or something
the action of putting your hand, finger, or another part of your body on something or someone

sentences.english: insects that damage crops
sentences.chinese: 破坏庄稼的昆虫

sentences.english: There may be permanent brain damage.
sentences.chinese: 可能有永久性脑损伤。

detailed_translations.english: to cause physical harm to something or to part of someone’s body
physical harm that is done to something or to a part of someone’s body, so that it is broken or injured

sentences.english: The scandal did his career a lot of harm.
sentences.chinese: 丑闻对他的职业生涯造成很大损害。

sentences.english: Our children deserve protection from harm.
sentences.chinese: 我们的儿童理应得到保护免受伤害。

sentences.english: chemicals that harm the environment
sentences.chinese: 损害环境的化学品

detailed_translations.english: damage, injury, or trouble caused by someone’s actions or by an event
to have a bad effect on something

sentences.english: Football occupies most of my leisure time.
sentences.chinese: 足球占去了我大部分的闲暇时间。

detailed_translations.english: if something occupies you or your time, you are busy doing it

sentences.english: She’s busy now – can you phone later?
sentences.chinese: 她现在正忙，你稍后打来好吗？

sentences.english: a busy mother of four
sentences.chinese: 一个忙忙碌碌、育有四个孩子的妈妈

sentences.english: There were lots of activities to keep the kids busy .
sentences.chinese: 有很多活动可以让孩子们不闲着。

sentences.english: December is the busiest time of year for shops.
sentences.chinese: 十二月份是一年中商店最繁忙的时期。

detailed_translations.english: if you are busy, you are working hard and have a lot of things to do

sentences.english: She was offered employment in the sales office.
sentences.chinese: 她获聘在销售部工作。

sentences.english: terms and conditions of employment
sentences.chinese: 雇用条款和条件

sentences.english: Steve’s still looking for full-time employment.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫还在寻找全职工作。

sentences.english: the needs of women who combine paid employment and care for their families
sentences.chinese: 兼顾有薪工作和照料家庭的女性的需要

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作； 雇用； 使用
detailed_translations.english: the condition of having a paid job

sentences.english: Everyone cries sometimes – it’s nothing to be ashamed of.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都会有哭的时候——没什么好难为情的。

detailed_translations.english: feeling very sorry and embarrassed because of something you have done

sentences.english: a modest and humble man
sentences.chinese: 一个谦卑的男人

sentences.english: Honda won fame in the 1980s as the little car company that humbled the industry giants.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代，本田作为一家小型汽车公司因一举击垮行业巨头而声名鹊起。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦逊的；简陋的；（级别或地位）低下的；不大的
detailed_translations.english: not considering yourself or your ideas to be as important as other people’s

detailed_translations.chinese: 使谦恭；轻松打败（尤指强大的对手）；低声下气
detailed_translations.english: If you humble someone who is more important or powerful than you, you defeat them easily

sentences.english: Has anything been decided yet?
sentences.chinese: 已经作出什么决定了吗？

sentences.english: The trainees decide among themselves what programs to take.
sentences.chinese: 受训者自行选择课程。

sentences.english: After a long discussion, they decided in favour of (= chose ) the older applicant.
sentences.chinese: 经过长时间的讨论，他们决定选那位较年长的求职者。

detailed_translations.english: to make a choice or judgment about something, especially after considering all the possibilities or arguments

sentences.english: The police asked her to describe the man.
sentences.chinese: 警察叫她描述一下那名男子。

sentences.english: Another approach to the problem is described in Chapter 3.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题的另一种解决方法在第三章有所阐述。

detailed_translations.chinese: 形容， 描写； 画出
detailed_translations.english: to say what something or someone is like by giving details about them

sentences.english: The booklet gives a brief description of each place.
sentences.chinese: 这本小册子对每一个地方都作了简短的介绍。

sentences.english: Berlin sounds fascinating from your description.
sentences.chinese: 从你的描述来看，柏林是个迷人的城市。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing or speech that gives details about what someone or something is like

sentences.english: The Sergeant told Swift to guard the entrance.
sentences.chinese: 中士叫斯威夫特守着入口。

sentences.english: a lioness guarding her cubs
sentences.chinese: 守护着幼狮的母狮

sentences.english: There were two security guards on duty outside the building.
sentences.chinese: 大楼外面有两名保安在值勤。

detailed_translations.english: to protect a person, place, or object by staying near them and watching them
someone whose job is to protect a place or person

sentences.english: The lobby is empty but for the postman and his broom.
sentences.chinese: 大厅里除了邮差和他的扫帚以外别无他人。

sentences.english: As a rule, where the broom does not reach the dust will not vanish of itself.
sentences.chinese: 扫帚不到, 灰尘照例不会自己跑掉。

detailed_translations.english: a large brush with a long handle, used for sweeping floors

sentences.english: She swam and sunbathed, went sightseeing and relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 她游泳，晒日光浴，观光，放松。

detailed_translations.english: when you visit famous or interesting places, especially as tourists

sentences.english: They hoped to defeat the enemy at sea.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望在海上击败敌人。

sentences.english: She was a woman who hated to admit defeat.
sentences.chinese: 她是个不愿认输的女人。

detailed_translations.english: to win a victory over someone in a war, competition, game etc
failure to win or succeed

sentences.english: That information is not in our possession.
sentences.chinese: 那则信息不归我们所有。

sentences.english: How did the painting come into your possession (= how did you get it ) ?
sentences.chinese: 这幅画是怎么到你手上的？

sentences.english: The finance company now has possession of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这家金融公司目前拥有这所房子。

sentences.english: We didn’t take possession of (= get and start using ) the car until a few days after the auction.
sentences.chinese: 拍卖会过后几天我们才正式拿到那辆车。

detailed_translations.english: if something is in your possession, you own it, or you have obtained it from somewhere

sentences.english: Different workers possess different skills.
sentences.chinese: 不同的工人拥有不同技能。

sentences.english: He no longer possessed the power to frighten her.
sentences.chinese: 他再也吓不倒她了。

detailed_translations.english: to have a particular quality or ability

sentences.english: He was now the proud owner of a bright red sports car.
sentences.chinese: 他现在拥有了一辆亮红色跑车，很是自豪。

detailed_translations.english: someone who owns something

sentences.english: In this particular case, no one else was involved.
sentences.chinese: 这件事没有其他人牵涉其中。

sentences.english: Most students choose one particular area for research.
sentences.chinese: 大多数学生选择一个特定领域进行研究。

sentences.english: Marty’s very particular about his food.
sentences.chinese: 马蒂对食物很挑剔。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特别的，特指的；讲究的；挑剔的，吹毛求疵的
detailed_translations.english: a particular thing or person is the one that you are talking about, and not any other

sentences.english: Joyce took especial care to include her.
sentences.chinese: 乔伊斯特别留意把她加进来。

detailed_translations.english: Especial means unusual or special in some way

sentences.english: This one in particular.
sentences.chinese: 这个人很特别。

sentences.english: For any place, but in particular for any city to live, you must have faith in it, in its reality and significance.
sentences.chinese: 对于任何地方，特别是对于一个居住城市而言，你必须对它有信心、对它的现实和意义有信心。

sentences.english: The goals and scope, in particular, show you the direction to move.
sentences.chinese: 特别是目标和范围能告诉您下一步工作的方向。

sentences.english: Steve was in a particularly bad mood when he got back.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫回来时情绪特别不好。

sentences.english: The restaurant is particularly popular with young people.
sentences.chinese: 那家餐厅尤其受到年轻人的欢迎。

sentences.english: We are hoping to expand our business, particularly in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望扩大业务，尤其是在欧洲。

sentences.english: British farmers, particularly those producing lamb, are very worried.
sentences.chinese: 英国农场主，尤其是养羊羔的农场主，非常担忧。

detailed_translations.english: more than usual or more than others

sentences.english: Your stereo is better than mine.
sentences.chinese: 你的音响比我的好。

sentences.english: There must be a better way to do this.
sentences.chinese: 一定还有更好的办法来做这件事。

sentences.english: He can speak French a lot better than I can.
sentences.chinese: 他法语讲得比我好多了。

detailed_translations.english: more useful, interesting, satisfactory, effective, suitable etc
to a higher standard or quality

sentences.english: The officials said that they had been offered bribes before an important game.
sentences.chinese: 这几名官员说，有人在一场重要比赛之前向他们行贿。

sentences.english: The only way we could get into the country was by bribing the border officials.
sentences.chinese: 我们要进入这个国家，唯一的办法是贿赂边境官员。

detailed_translations.english: money or a gift that you illegally give someone to persuade them to do something for you
to illegally give someone, especially a public official, money or a gift in order to persuade them to do something for you

sentences.english: We tried everything – persuasion, bribery, threats.
sentences.chinese: 我们什么都试过——劝过，给过好处，也威胁过。

sentences.english: He was found guilty of bribery and corruption (=  bribery and dishonest behaviour  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他被判犯有贿赂和徇私舞弊罪。

detailed_translations.english: the act of giving bribes

sentences.english: The crowd parted to let the truck pass.
sentences.chinese: 人群分开让卡车通过。

sentences.english: He gave me a smile as he passed.
sentences.chinese: 他经过时对我微笑了一下。

sentences.english: We passed a group of students outside the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 我们在戏院外从一群学生身旁经过。

sentences.english: I pass the sports centre on the way to work.
sentences.chinese: 我上班的路上经过体育中心。

sentences.english: The road passes right through the town centre.
sentences.chinese: 那条路正好穿过镇中心。

sentences.english: We passed the winter pleasantly enough.
sentences.chinese: 我们相当愉快地度过了那个冬季。

detailed_translations.english: to come up to a particular place, person, or object and go past them

sentences.english: The user name should consist of alphanumeric characters and be a valid structure for all systems within an organization so that each person only has one user name.
sentences.chinese: 用户名应该由字母数字字符组成，并且对于组织内部所有的系统都应该是有效的结构，以便每个人只使用一个用户名。

sentences.english: Smacking is not an acceptable way of punishing a child.
sentences.chinese: 要惩罚孩子，不应该用打的方式。

sentences.english: He promised to punish severely any officials found guilty of electoral fraud.
sentences.chinese: 他承诺要严惩任何在选举中有欺诈行为的官员。

sentences.english: They deserve to be punished for putting passengers at risk.
sentences.chinese: 他们置乘客于危险之中，理应受到惩罚。

sentences.english: I felt I was being punished for what my mother had done.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得自己在为妈妈的所作所为接受惩罚。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone suffer because they have done something wrong or broken the law

sentences.english: ...a group that campaigns against the physical punishment of children.
sentences.chinese: …一个发起运动反对体罚儿童的组织。

detailed_translations.english: Punishment is the act of punishing someone or of being punished

sentences.english: Eric went to Seattle to visit his cousins.
sentences.chinese: 埃里克到西雅图去看望他的表兄弟。

detailed_translations.english: to go and spend time in a place or with someone, especially for pleasure or interest

sentences.english: Times Square attracts more than 30 million visitors annually.
sentences.chinese: 时代广场每年吸引三千多万游客。

detailed_translations.chinese: 访问者，参观者；视察者；候鸟
detailed_translations.english: someone who comes to visit a place or a person

sentences.english: They went to the mosque to pray.
sentences.chinese: 他们去清真寺祷告。

detailed_translations.english: to speak to God in order to ask for help or give thanks

sentences.english: He was regarded as the most successful president of modern times.
sentences.chinese: 他被看成是近代最成功的总统。

detailed_translations.english: to think about someone or something in a particular way

sentences.english: Michael has already spent considerable time in Barcelona.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔在巴塞罗那已经待了相当长的时间了。

sentences.english: issues of considerable importance
sentences.chinese: 相当重要的问题

sentences.english: The series has aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 这套系列节目引起了观众相当浓厚的兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: fairly large, especially large enough to have an effect or be important

sentences.english: Please pay the full amount (=  of money  ) by the end of the month.
sentences.chinese: 请在月底前全额付清。

detailed_translations.english: a quantity of something such as time, money, or a substance

sentences.english: He was moved by her obvious concern.
sentences.chinese: 她明显的关心使他感动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 关切的事，有关的事；关心，挂念；关系，关联；公司，企业
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of wanting someone to be happy and healthy

detailed_translations.chinese: 涉及， 有关； 使关心， 使担心
detailed_translations.english: if a story, book, report etc concerns someone or something, it is about them

sentences.english: calls from young children concerning lost pets
sentences.chinese: 小孩子打来的有关宠物走失的电话

sentences.english: the facts concerning Marr’s car crash
sentences.chinese: 有关马尔撞车事故的事实

detailed_translations.english: about or relating to

sentences.english: Knock before you enter.

sentences.chinese: 你今年有没有预订去度假？
