to make arrangements to stay in a place, eat in a restaurant, go to a theatre etc at a particular time in the future

sentences.english: She deputed the bookkeeping to me while he was away.
sentences.chinese: 在他外出时他把簿记工作交给了我。

sentences.english: It requires some kind of bookkeeping to keep records about transactions.
sentences.chinese: 它要求某些种类的簿记保存有关交易的记录。

sentences.english: Through those groups, the women learn to read and write, and learn bookkeeping and other skills.
sentences.chinese: 加入这些小组后，妇女们可以学识字和写字，学习记帐和其它技能。

detailed_translations.english: Bookkeeping is the job or activity of keeping an accurate record of the money that is spent and received by a business or other organization

sentences.english: When Hamilton was 11 years old, his mother died. Hamilton got a job as an assistant bookkeeper. He learned how to keep financial records.
sentences.chinese: 他的母亲在他11岁时去世了。汉密尔顿得到了一份给会计当助手的工作。他学会了如何记账。

sentences.english: His friends live above the bookshop.
sentences.chinese: 他的朋友们住在书店的楼上。

sentences.english: Do you know where I can find a good bookshop?
sentences.chinese: 你知道我在哪里可以找到好书店?

sentences.english: If you can't do anything on that scale (travel far and wide, or go back to college), you may chose to go to an interesting lecture at a bookshop and come away quite stimulated by what you hear.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在这一时期什么也不能做（比如旅行，郊游，读书等），那么你可以选择参加书店里有趣的演讲，你将会听到非常刺激的东西。

detailed_translations.english: a shop that sells books

sentences.english: The full address is given on page 15.
sentences.chinese: 详细地址见第15页。

sentences.english: You will find the answers over the page .
sentences.chinese: 答案见下页。

sentences.english: a 400﹣page novel
sentences.chinese: 一本400页的小说

sentences.english: We took out a full page advertisement in the ‘Village Voice’.
sentences.chinese: 我们在《村声》上投放了一整版广告。

detailed_translations.english: one side of a piece of paper in a book, newspaper, document etc, or the sheet of paper itself

sentences.english: a house with a view across the bay
sentences.chinese: 能看到海湾全景的一幢房子

sentences.english: Montego Bay
sentences.chinese: 蒙特哥湾

sentences.english: A dog suddenly howled, baying at the moon.
sentences.chinese: 一只狗忽然嚎叫起来，对月长嗥。

detailed_translations.english: a part of the sea that is partly enclosed by a curve in the land
If a dog or wolf bays, it makes loud, long cries

sentences.english: the iron and steel industry
sentences.chinese: 钢铁工业

sentences.english: a driveway with large iron gates
sentences.chinese: 安装了大铁门的私家车道

sentences.english: the absorption of iron from food
sentences.chinese: 对食物中铁的吸收

sentences.english: ...a man of icy nerve and iron will.
sentences.chinese: …一个头脑冷静、意志坚强的男人。

detailed_translations.english: a common hard metal that is used to make steel, is  magnetic  , and is found in very small quantities in food and blood. It is a chemical  element  : symbol Fe
to make clothes smooth using an iron
You can use iron to describe the character or behaviour of someone who is very firm in their decisions and actions, or who can control their feelings well

sentences.english: We’re getting to the stage where we hardly ever go out together.
sentences.chinese: 我们快要到几乎不一起外出的地步了。

sentences.english: She is on stage for most of the play.
sentences.chinese: 这出戏的大部分时间里她都在台上

detailed_translations.english: a particular time or state that something reaches as it grows or develops

sentences.english: a small bundle containing mostly clothing
sentences.chinese: 一个小包袱，里面主要是衣服

sentences.english: He was bundled into a car and driven 50 miles to a police station.
sentences.chinese: 他被塞进一辆小汽车，被带到50英里外的警察局。

detailed_translations.english: a group of things such as papers, clothes, or sticks that are fastened or tied together

detailed_translations.chinese: 收集， 归拢； 把…塞入
detailed_translations.english: If someone is bundled somewhere, someone pushes them there in a rough and hurried way

sentences.english: His family responsibilities had started to become a burden.
sentences.chinese: 家庭责任已开始成为他的负担。

detailed_translations.english: something difficult or worrying that you are responsible for

sentences.english: Edinburgh Castle
sentences.chinese: 爱丁堡城堡

sentences.english: a ruined castle
sentences.chinese: 破败的城堡

detailed_translations.english: a very large strong building, built in the past as a safe place that could be easily defended against attack

detailed_translations.chinese: 置…于城堡中；筑城堡防御

sentences.english: We need our schools to teach students to be good citizens.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要学校把学生培养为好公民。

sentences.english: The mayor urged citizens to begin preparing for a major storm.
sentences.chinese: 一场特大暴风雨即将到来，市长敦促市民做好准备。

detailed_translations.english: someone who lives in a particular town, country, or state

sentences.english: They were married in a civil ceremony in May.
sentences.chinese: 他们在五月份举行了世俗婚礼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 公民的；民间的；文职的；有礼貌的；根据民法的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the people who live in a country

sentences.english: a clerk in a commercial firm
sentences.chinese: 一家商行的文员

detailed_translations.chinese: 职员，办事员；店员；书记；记账员；<古>牧师，教士
detailed_translations.english: someone who keeps records or accounts in an office

detailed_translations.chinese: 当销售员，当店员；当职员
detailed_translations.english: to work as a clerk

sentences.english: Paul’s an easy-going sort of fellow.
sentences.chinese: 保罗人很随和。

detailed_translations.english: a man

sentences.english: a scrubbing brush
sentences.chinese: 硬毛刷，板刷

detailed_translations.english: an object that you use for cleaning, painting, making your hair tidy etc, made with a lot of hairs,  bristle s  , or thin pieces of plastic, fastened to a handle

sentences.english: I took a bus to San Francisco.
sentences.chinese: 我乘公共汽车去旧金山。

sentences.english: Buses run at 15 and 30 minutes past the hour.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车在每小时的15分和30分时发车。

detailed_translations.english: a large vehicle that people pay to travel on

sentences.english: a rose bush
sentences.chinese: 玫瑰丛

sentences.english: The child was hiding in the bushes.
sentences.chinese: 那孩子躲在灌木丛里。

detailed_translations.english: a plant with many thin branches growing up from the ground

detailed_translations.chinese: 以灌木装饰；使…精疲力竭
如灌木般长得低矮的；粗野的

sentences.english: a bushy tail
sentences.chinese: 毛茸茸的尾巴

detailed_translations.chinese: 浓密的；灌木茂密的；多毛的
detailed_translations.english: bushy hair or fur grows thickly

sentences.english: Can I have some bread and butter?
sentences.chinese: 能给我一些面包和黄油吗?。

sentences.english: Do you like butter?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢黄油吗？

sentences.english: We never use cheese, butter or something like that to cook it.
sentences.chinese: 我们从未使用乳酪，黄油或者类如此物来烹调食品。

detailed_translations.english: a solid yellow food made from milk or cream that you spread on bread or use in cooking
to spread butter on something

sentences.english: We went to a cafe and lazed the whole afternoon away there.
sentences.chinese: 我们去了一间咖啡馆，在那儿消磨了整个下午。

sentences.english: Marshal turned to watch her as she walked through the cafe, then he turned to us.
sentences.chinese: 元帅转向看她，她走过的咖啡馆，然后他转过身来给我们。

sentences.english: At a cat “cafe,” the emphasis is not on food and beverages but relaxing in the company of cats.
sentences.chinese: 在猫咪咖啡馆，重点不在于食物和饮料，而在于有猫咪陪伴的那份轻松愉快。

sentences.english: Then the journey continues on to a campsite where camels await you.
sentences.chinese: 然后继续前往一个营地，在那里会有骆驼恭候大驾。

sentences.english: Standing just 100 feet from his wife, Kirsta, and two toddlers at the campsite, Britton tried to run away from the lion into a clearing, but the lion followed him.
sentences.chinese: 在离他仅有100英尺的营地里，有他的妻子克里斯塔和两个刚学走路的孩子。 布里顿试图跑到开阔地，但是狮子却跟随着他。

sentences.english: The smell of the food might attract dangerous animals to our campsite.
sentences.chinese: 食物的气味还可能会招引危险的动物到我们的营地来。

detailed_translations.english: an area where people can camp, often with a water supply and toilets

sentences.english: A cup of rice which cost thirty cents a few weeks ago is now being sold for up to one dollar.
sentences.chinese: 几周前价值30美分的1杯米如今卖到了1美元。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分；一分的硬币；森特（等于半音程的百分之一）
detailed_translations.english: 1/100th of the standard unit of money in some countries. For example, there are 100 cents in one dollar or in one  euro  : symbol ¢.

sentences.english: If someone invited me over to Florida, I’d jump at the chance (= use the opportunity eagerly ) .
sentences.chinese: 如果有人邀请我去佛罗里达，我会赶紧抓住这个机会。

sentences.english: There’s always the chance that something will go wrong.
sentences.chinese: 总有可能会出现问题。

sentences.english: If we did move to London, I’d stand a much better chance (= have a much better chance ) of getting a job.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们真的搬到伦敦去，我找到工作的机会就大多了。

sentences.english: There is little chance of her being found alive.
sentences.chinese: 她生还的可能性很小。

detailed_translations.english: a time or situation which you can use to do something that you want to do

sentences.english: He has a cheerful but quiet character.
sentences.chinese: 他的性格乐观文静。

sentences.english: Everyone recognizes Disney’s cartoon characters.
sentences.chinese: 迪士尼的卡通人物尽人皆知。

sentences.english: The whole character of the school has changed.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校的特色已经完全变了。

detailed_translations.english: the particular combination of qualities that makes someone a particular type of person

sentences.english: I’ll have to ask my boss for a day off.
sentences.chinese: 我得向老板请一天假。

sentences.english: Since I’m my own boss (=  I work for myself, rather than for an employer  ) , my hours are flexible.
sentences.chinese: 我自己当老板，所以我的时间很灵活。

sentences.english: Five-year-old girls love to boss people around.
sentences.chinese: 五岁的女孩就爱支使别人。

detailed_translations.english: the person who employs you or who is in charge of you at work
to tell people to do things, give them orders etc, especially when you have no authority to do it

sentences.english: One of the chief causes of crime today is drugs.
sentences.chinese: 毒品是如今犯罪的主要诱因之一。

sentences.english: Safety is our chief concern .
sentences.chinese: 安全问题是我们的头等大事。

sentences.english: The chief reason for this is that people are living longer.
sentences.chinese: 这主要是因为人们更长寿了。

sentences.english: his chief rival for the job
sentences.chinese: 和他竞争这份工作的主要对手

sentences.english: the prosecution’s chief witness
sentences.chinese: 控方的主要证人

sentences.english: She had many reasons for taking the money, but chief among them was revenge.
sentences.chinese: 她拿这笔钱的原因有很多，但最主要的是为了报复。

detailed_translations.english: most important

detailed_translations.chinese: 首领， 长官； 酋长， 族长
detailed_translations.english: the ruler of a tribe

sentences.english: He kissed the top of her head.
sentences.chinese: 他吻了一下她的头顶。

sentences.english: Alan fell asleep as soon as he put his head on the pillow.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦头一挨枕头就睡着了。

sentences.english: They dived head first into the water.
sentences.chinese: 他们一头跳进水中。

sentences.english: She was dressed in black from head to foot (= over all her body ).
sentences.chinese: 她从头到脚穿了一身黑。

sentences.english: He still has a full head of hair (= has all his hair, even though he is getting rather old ).
sentences.chinese: 他依然满头浓发。

sentences.english: Jenny marched proudly at the head of the procession.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮自豪地走在游行队伍的前列。

sentences.english: David was asked to head up the technical team.
sentences.chinese: 戴维被要求领导技术小组。

detailed_translations.english: the top part of your body that has your face at the front and is supported by your neck
to be in charge of a team, government, organization etc
the People's Republic of China

sentences.english: Do you fancy going out for a Chinese?
sentences.chinese: 你想不想出去吃顿中餐？

detailed_translations.english: relating to China, its people, or its language
people from China

sentences.english: ...a heart surgeon.
sentences.chinese: …一位心脏外科医生。

detailed_translations.english: a doctor who does operations in a hospital

sentences.english: the Christian religion
sentences.chinese: 基督教

sentences.english: the Christian church
sentences.chinese: 基督教会

sentences.english: a Christian minister
sentences.chinese: 基督教牧师

detailed_translations.english: related to Christianity

sentences.english: Tom offered to sleep on the couch.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆说他来睡沙发。

detailed_translations.english: a comfortable piece of furniture big enough for two or three people to sit on

sentences.english: My cousin Mark helped me to bring in the bags.
sentences.chinese: 我表弟马克帮我把包提了进来。

detailed_translations.english: the child of your uncle or aunt

sentences.english: fresh cream
sentences.chinese: 鲜奶油

sentences.english: strawberries and cream
sentences.chinese: 浇奶油的草莓

sentences.english: cream silk stockings
sentences.chinese: 乳白色的长筒丝袜

detailed_translations.english: a thick yellow-white liquid that rises to the top of milk

sentences.english: We’ve been waiting here since two o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 我们从两点钟开始就在这里等了。

sentences.english: I haven’t played rugby since I left university.
sentences.chinese: 我大学毕业后就没打过橄榄球。

sentences.english: She left London ten years ago, and I haven’t seen her since.
sentences.chinese: 她十年前离开伦敦，此后我再没有见过她。

sentences.english: The factory has been here since the 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂从 20 世纪 70 年代起就在这里了。

sentences.english: It was exactly five years since her father had died.
sentences.chinese: 从她父亲去世到现在正好满五年。

sentences.english: Since the end of the war, over five thousand prisoners have been released.
sentences.chinese: 自从战争结束以后，已有五千多名战俘获释。

sentences.english: He lost his job five years ago, but has since found other work.
sentences.chinese: 他五年前失去工作，但此后找到了其他工作。

sentences.english: I left school in 1995, and since then I’ve lived in London.
sentences.chinese: 我 1995 年离开学校，此后就在伦敦生活。

sentences.english: About six thousand people were arrested, several hundred of whom have since been released.
sentences.chinese: 约六千人被逮捕，不过他们中有几百人后来被释放了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 因为；由于；既然；自…以来；自…以后

detailed_translations.english: from a particular time or event in the past until the present, or in that period of time
When you are talking about an event or situation in the past, you use since to indicate that another event happened at some point later in time

sentences.english: We could go back to my cottage and have lunch there.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以回到我的小屋去吃午饭。

sentences.english: Scotland? I’ve always wanted to go there.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰？我一直想去那儿。

sentences.english: Hold it right there and don’t move.
sentences.chinese: 就站在那里，不要动。

sentences.english: Can you pass me that wine glass there?
sentences.chinese: 你能把那个葡萄酒杯递给我吗？

sentences.english: Look, there’s that bookshop I was telling you about.
sentences.chinese: 看，那就是我跟你说过的那家书店。

sentences.english: Who’s that man over there ?
sentences.chinese: 那边的那个男人是谁？

sentences.english: It’s too far to drive there and back in one day.
sentences.chinese: 一天开车来回太远了。

sentences.english: Are we going to get there (= arrive ) before the banks close?
sentences.chinese: 银行关门之前，我们到得了吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 在那里；在那边；在那点上
detailed_translations.english: in or to a particular place that is not where you are
used to express satisfaction that you have been proved right or that you have done what you intended to do

sentences.english: They finally found the cat up on the roof.
sentences.chinese: 他们最后在屋顶上找到了那只猫。

sentences.english: a flat roof
sentences.chinese: 平顶

sentences.english: a pitched roof
sentences.chinese: 斜顶

detailed_translations.chinese: 屋顶；最高处，顶部；最高限度
detailed_translations.english: the structure that covers or forms the top of a building, vehicle, tent etc
to put a roof on a building

sentences.english: It’s an interesting thought.
sentences.chinese: 这想法很有趣。

sentences.english: The thought that I might not have a job next year is a bit troubling.
sentences.chinese: 想到明年可能失业我有点心烦。

detailed_translations.english: something that you think of, remember, or realize

detailed_translations.chinese: 想，思考；认为（think的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: I wish I had known then what I know now.
sentences.chinese: 我真希望那时我就知道现在所知道的一切。

sentences.english: It was then that I realised she’d tricked me.
sentences.chinese: 直到那时我才知道她骗了我。

sentences.english: He started his career in St Petersburg – or Leningrad as it then was.
sentences.chinese: 他在圣彼得堡——当时叫列宁格勒——开始他的事业。

sentences.english: They met in 1942 and from then on (= starting at that time ) they were firm friends.
sentences.chinese: 他们1942年认识，从那时起就一直是好朋友。

sentences.english: Silently she closed the door. Just then she heard a noise.
sentences.chinese: 她默不作声地关上了门。 就在那时，她听到有声响。

sentences.english: I was paid £1,000, which was a lot of money back then (= a long time ago when things were different ) in the 1950s.
sentences.chinese: 他们给了我1,000英镑，在20世纪50年代那可是一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 然后；那么；于是；当时；此外
detailed_translations.english: at a particular time in the past or future

sentences.english: Lady Spencer
sentences.chinese: 斯宾塞夫人

sentences.english: the lords and ladies of the court
sentences.chinese: 宫廷的贵族及夫人

detailed_translations.english: used as the title of the wife or daughter of a British noblemanor the wife of a knight

sentences.english: Steam rose from the hot tub.
sentences.chinese: 水蒸气从热腾腾的浴缸里升起。

detailed_translations.english: the hot mist that water produces when it is boiled
if something steams, steam rises from it, especially because it is hot
if something steams, steam rises from it, especially because it is hot

sentences.english: The steamer touched at 3 ports.
sentences.chinese: 这艘轮船曾停靠3个港口。

sentences.english: When does your steamer sail?
sentences.chinese: 你们的轮船什么时候启航?

sentences.english: We were together only during the few days the steamer took from Calcutta to Madras, but it became quite evident that depth of friendship does not depend upon length of acquaintance.
sentences.chinese: 我们只是在从加尔各答到马德拉斯的轮船上呆了几天，但很明显，友谊的深厚并不取决于认识的长久。

detailed_translations.english: a  steamship

sentences.english: After the war many soldiers stayed in France.
sentences.chinese: 战后，许多士兵留在法国。

sentences.english: I go swimming every day after work.
sentences.chinese: 我每天下班后都去游泳。

sentences.english: Do you believe in life after death?
sentences.chinese: 你相信人死后还有来生吗？

sentences.english: The first attack started just after midnight.
sentences.chinese: 刚过午夜，第一波进攻开始了。

sentences.english: David went to bed straight after (=  immediately after  ) supper.
sentences.chinese: 戴维一吃完晚饭就去睡觉了。

sentences.english: After you’d called the police, what did you do?
sentences.chinese: 报警之后，你做了些什么？

sentences.english: Zimmerman changed his name after he left Germany.
sentences.chinese: 齐默尔曼离开德国后改了名字。

sentences.english: People still remember the 1958 revolution and what came after (=  happened after it  ) .
sentences.chinese: 人们依然记得1958年的那场革命和之后发生的事。

detailed_translations.english: when a particular event or time has happened, or when someone has done something

sentences.english: They tried to chart the sea area between Norway and Denmark.
sentences.chinese: 他们企图绘制挪威与丹麦之间的海域图。

sentences.english: I think they should be careful about that, but I applaud them for taking up the mantle out there in Denmark.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他们应该注意那一点，但是我赞赏他们为填补丹麦在这方面的空白所作出的贡献。

sentences.english: If it does, then the happiest countries in 2011 are likely to be rich countries like Denmark and Switzerland.
sentences.chinese: 如果可以的话，那么在2011年最幸福的国家可能会是像丹麦和瑞士这样富有的国家。

sentences.english: The court of inquiry ruled that the crash was due to pilot error.
sentences.chinese: 调查法庭裁定飞机失事是由驾驶员的失误造成的。

sentences.english: She has been absent from work due to illness.
sentences.chinese: 她因病没去上班。

sentences.english: The restaurant’s success was due largely to its new manager.
sentences.chinese: 这家餐馆的成功很大程度上归功于新来的经理。

sentences.english: Attendance at the meeting was small, due in part to (= partly because of ) the absence of teachers.
sentences.chinese: 参加会议的人数不多，部分原因是教师缺席。

detailed_translations.english: because of something

sentences.english: Our grateful thanks go to all who participated.
sentences.chinese: 我们衷心感谢所有参与者。

sentences.english: She gave me a grateful look.
sentences.chinese: 她感激地看了我一眼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感谢的；令人愉快的，宜人的
detailed_translations.english: feeling that you want to thank someone because of something kind that they have done, or showing this feeling

sentences.english: Most of the time I'm just thankful that I've got a job.
sentences.chinese: 大部分时候我庆幸自己有了份工作。

detailed_translations.english: grateful and glad about something that has happened, especially because without it the situation would be much worse

sentences.english: I gather all my thanksgiving and delight into my walking.
sentences.chinese: 我将我所有的感恩和愉悦注入到走路中。

detailed_translations.english: an expression of thanks to God

sentences.english: I may be late, so don’t wait for me.
sentences.chinese: 我可能会迟到，所以别等我。

sentences.english: Some chemicals may cause environmental damage.
sentences.chinese: 有些化学物品可能会给环境造成破坏。

sentences.english: There may not be enough money to pay for the repairs.
sentences.chinese: 可能钱不够支付修理费。

sentences.english: Well, I may have been wrong.
sentences.chinese: 好了，可能是我错了。

sentences.english: They may have called while you were out.
sentences.chinese: 你出去时他们可能给你打过电话。

sentences.english: It may be that Minoan ships were built and repaired here.
sentences.chinese: 米诺斯人的船可能就是在这里建造和修理的。

sentences.english: Your job may well involve some travelling (= it is fairly likely ) .
sentences.chinese: 你的工作很可能有时需要出差。

sentences.english: The problem may be solved in a number of different ways.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题可以用几种不同的方式解决。

sentences.english: We pray for those who died – may they rest in peace.
sentences.chinese: 我们为逝者祈祷——愿他们安息。

detailed_translations.english: if something may happen or may be true, there is a possibility that it will happen or be true but this is not certain

sentences.english: We obtained a loan from the government.
sentences.chinese: 我们得了一笔政府贷款。

sentences.english: If you ask him for a loan, he'll come through.
sentences.chinese: 如果你向他贷款，他会满足你的要求的。

sentences.english: The company won't keep going unless we can get some loan.
sentences.chinese: 除非我们能搞到贷款，否则公司就维持不下去了。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you borrow from a bank etc

sentences.english: Mr Kobayashi was chosen to represent the company at the conference.
sentences.chinese: 小林先生被选中代表公司出席会议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 作为…的代表， 表示， 象征； 描绘， 表现
detailed_translations.english: to officially speak or take action for another person or group of people

sentences.english: He got out of the car and looked underneath.
sentences.chinese: 他下车往底下看了看。

sentences.english: It’s near where the railway goes underneath the road.
sentences.chinese: 它靠近铁路从公路下方穿过的地方。

sentences.english: She was wearing a smart jacket with a T-shirt underneath.
sentences.chinese: 她穿了件时髦的夹克，里面是一件 T 恤衫。

sentences.english: Her blonde hair was hidden underneath a baseball cap.
sentences.chinese: 一顶棒球帽裹住了她的满头金发。

sentences.english: He has on his jeans and a long-sleeved blue denim shirt with a white T-shirt underneath.
sentences.chinese: 他身穿牛仔裤和一件蓝色长袖粗斜纹棉布衬衫，里面还有件白色T恤衫。

sentences.english: The shooting-range is lit from underneath by rows of ruby-red light fixtures.
sentences.chinese: 射击场被一排排宝石红照明装置从下面照亮。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在…的下面；在…的形式下；在…的支配下
detailed_translations.english: directly under another object or covered by it
Underneath is also an adverb
the bottom surface of something, or the part of something that is below or under something else

sentences.english: ‘You never cared about me.’ ‘That’s not true.’
sentences.chinese: “你从不关心我。”“那不是事实。”

sentences.english: I wish you wouldn’t say things like that.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你不要那么说。

sentences.english: What did you do with those sandwiches?
sentences.chinese: 那些三明治你怎么处理了？

sentences.english: Victoria Street? That’s where my sister lives.
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚街？我的姐姐就住在那儿。

sentences.english: Do you remember that nice Mr Hoskins who came to dinner?
sentences.chinese: 你还记得那位来这儿吃过晚饭的好人霍斯金斯先生吗？

sentences.english: I’ve got that pain in my back again.
sentences.chinese: 我的背又疼起来了。

sentences.english: He killed a man once and that’s why he had to leave Ireland.
sentences.chinese: 他曾杀死过一个人，这就是他不得不离开爱尔兰的原因。

sentences.english: ‘We’ve been cheated,’ she said. Those were her exact words.
sentences.chinese: “我们被骗了。”她说。这是她的原话。

sentences.english: ‘I have to go,’ she said, and with that (= after saying that ) she hung up the phone.
sentences.chinese: “我得走了。”说完她就把电话挂了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 那，那个〔指已经提到或已经知道的人、事物、想法等〕
detailed_translations.english: used to refer to a person, thing, idea etc that has already been mentioned or is already known about

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔用于动词、名词或形容词后引导一个从句，表示某人所说或所想，或陈述一个事实或理由〕
detailed_translations.english: used after verbs, nouns, and adjectives to introduce a  clause  which shows what someone says or thinks, or states a fact or reason

detailed_translations.chinese: 那么〔大、多等〕〔尤指通过手势比画来表示大小、数量等〕
detailed_translations.english: used to say how big, how much etc, especially when you are showing the size, amount etc with your hands

sentences.english: He described the scene to me.
sentences.chinese: 他向我描述了那个情景。

sentences.english: He telegraphed me to go to the party.
sentences.chinese: 他发电报要我去参加那个聚会。

sentences.english: The world exists, whether you like it or not.
sentences.chinese: 不管你喜欢与否，这个世界照样存在。

detailed_translations.chinese: 更加（用于比较级，最高级前）
detailed_translations.english: used before two  comparative  adjectives or adverbs to show that the degree of one event or situation is related to the degree of another one

sentences.english: The average salary for a teacher is $39,000 a year.
sentences.chinese: 教师的平均工资是39,000美元一年。

detailed_translations.english: money that you receive as payment from the organization you work for, usually paid to you every month

sentences.english: Scientists have many theories about how the universe first came into existence (= started to exist ).
sentences.chinese: 关于宇宙的起源，科学家有多种理论。

sentences.english: Pablo led a miserable existence when he first moved to San Juan.
sentences.chinese: 巴勃罗刚搬到圣胡安时，生活很悲惨。

detailed_translations.english: the state of existing

sentences.english: The date on the letter was 30th August 1962.
sentences.chinese: 信上的日期是1962年8月30日。

sentences.english: What’s today’s date?
sentences.chinese: 今天几号？

sentences.english: Make sure you sign and date it at the bottom.
sentences.chinese: 一定要在底下签上姓名和日期。

detailed_translations.english: a particular day of the month or year, especially shown by a number
to write or print the date on something

sentences.english: It takes a steady hand to perform surgery.
sentences.chinese: 做手术手要稳。

sentences.english: The plane steadied, and the passengers relaxed
sentences.chinese: 飞机平稳后，乘客们松了一口气。

detailed_translations.english: firmly held in a particular position and not moving or shaking
to hold someone or something so they become more balanced or controlled, or to become more balanced or controlled

sentences.english: I didn’t read the last chapter of the book.
sentences.chinese: 我没有看这本书的最后一章。

sentences.english: Add the flour last.
sentences.chinese: 最后加面粉。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing at the end, with no others after
after everything or everyone else

sentences.english: He gave up a permanent job in order to freelance.
sentences.chinese: 他放弃了固定工作，为的是当一名自由职业者。

sentences.english: a permanent change in your eating habits
sentences.chinese: 饮食习惯的永久改变

sentences.english: The blindness that the disease causes will be permanent.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病引起的失明是永久性的。

sentences.english: Miller soon became a permanent fixture (= someone or something that is always there ) on the team.
sentences.chinese: 米勒很快就成为球队的固定队员。

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist for a long time or for all the time in the future

sentences.english: I’m going to have my hair permed .
sentences.chinese: 我要去烫头发。

sentences.english: her blonde permed hair
sentences.chinese: 她烫过的金色鬈发

detailed_translations.english: to make straight hair curly by using chemicals

sentences.english: I thumbed a lift into town.
sentences.chinese: 我拦顺路车进了城。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade a driver of a passing car to stop and take you somewhere, by putting your hand out with your thumb raised
the part of your hand that is shaped like a thick short finger and helps you to hold things

sentences.english: I’d just returned from covering the Cambodian war.
sentences.chinese: 我刚报道完柬埔寨战争回来。

detailed_translations.english: to report the details of an event for a newspaper or a television or radio programme

sentences.english: keeping the lid on inflation
sentences.chinese: 控制通货膨胀

detailed_translations.english: a cover for the open part of a pot, box, or other container

sentences.english: Carl sat up in bed, yawned, and stretched.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔从床上坐起来，打了个呵欠，伸了伸懒 腰。

sentences.english: Always stretch before exercising.
sentences.chinese: 锻炼之前都要做伸展运动。

detailed_translations.english: to straighten your arms, legs, or body to full length
to reach a long way for something

detailed_translations.chinese: 一段时间； 一段距离；延伸， 连绵； 连绵的一片
detailed_translations.english: a continuous period of time

sentences.english: You should keep in with your colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 你应当与你的同事友好相处。

sentences.english: You should not deprecate your own worth.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该贬低你自己的价值。

sentences.english: to issue/sign a declaration
sentences.chinese: 发布 / 签署公告

sentences.english: the declaration of war
sentences.chinese: 宣战

sentences.english: the Declaration of Independence (= of the United States)
sentences.chinese: （美国）独立宣言

detailed_translations.english: an official or formal statement, especially about the plans of a government or an organization; the act of making such a statement

sentences.english: Snails are considered a delicacy in France.
sentences.chinese: 在法国，蜗牛被认为是一种珍贵的美食。

detailed_translations.chinese: 美味；佳肴；微妙；精密；精美；敏锐，敏感；世故，圆滑
detailed_translations.english: something good to eat that is expensive or rare

sentences.english: We have to discover his plans and act accordingly.
sentences.chinese: 我们得找出他的计划，照着办。

sentences.english: Some of the laws were contradictory. Accordingly, measures were taken to clarify them.
sentences.chinese: 有些法律相互矛盾，因此，采取了措施将其阐明。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is appropriate to what has been done or said in a particular situation

sentences.english: Ann didn’t seem very sure.
sentences.chinese: 安看来并不十分肯定。

sentences.english: It seems a foolish decision now.
sentences.chinese: 现在看来这是一个愚蠢的决定。

sentences.english: It seems like you’re catching a cold, Taylor.
sentences.chinese: 你好像感冒了，泰勒。

sentences.english: ‘So Bill’s leaving her?’ ‘ So it seems (= that seems to be true ) .’
sentences.chinese: “这么说来，比尔要离开她？”“好像是这样。”

detailed_translations.english: if something seems to be true, there are qualities or facts that make people think it is true

sentences.english: tidal currents
sentences.chinese: 潮流

detailed_translations.chinese: 潮汐的；潮的，有关潮水的；定时涨落的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the regular rising and falling of the sea

sentences.english: The alterations doubled the value of the house.
sentences.chinese: 经改建后这所房子增值了一倍。

sentences.english: We decided to get the house valued.
sentences.chinese: 我们决定给房子估一估价。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that something is worth
to decide how much money something is worth, by comparing it with similar things

sentences.english: I’d say he’s around 50, but I’m only guessing.
sentences.chinese: 我想他50岁左右，不过也只是猜测。

sentences.english: What star sign are you? No, let me guess.
sentences.chinese: 你是什么星座的？别说，让我来猜猜看。

sentences.english: I’d say she’s about 35, but that’s only a guess.
sentences.chinese: 我说她大约35岁，不过那只是猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to try to answer a question or form an opinion when you are not sure whether you will be correct
an attempt to answer a question or make a judgement when you are not sure whether you will be correct

sentences.english: great thinkers such as Kant and Schopenhauer
sentences.chinese: 康德、叔本华等伟大的思想家

detailed_translations.english: someone who thinks carefully about important subjects such as science or  philosophy  , especially someone who is famous for thinking of new ideas

sentences.english: He erected a monument on the spot where his daughter was killed.
sentences.chinese: 他在女儿遇难的地方立了块纪念碑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 纪念碑；历史遗迹；不朽的作品
detailed_translations.english: a building,  statue  , or other large structure that is built to remind people of an important event or famous person

name: the doctor will fix you up
trans: der Arzt wird dich gesund machen

sentences.english: Jonson was his political heir as leader of the party.
sentences.chinese: 琼森是他的政治接班人，他将担任该党派的领袖。

detailed_translations.english: the person who has the legal right to receive the property or title of another person when they die

sentences.english: Lake Michigan
sentences.chinese: 密歇根湖

detailed_translations.english: a large area of water surrounded by land

name: the train is not due yet
trans: der Zug ist noch nicht fällig

sentences.english: Her hands were rough from hard work.
sentences.chinese: 她的双手因为干重活而变得很粗糙。

sentences.english: the rough terrain at the base of the mountains
sentences.chinese: 山脚下崎岖不平的地形

sentences.english: We were bumping over the rough ground.
sentences.chinese: 我们在崎岖的地面上颠簸而行。

sentences.english: a rough translation
sentences.chinese: 粗略的翻译

detailed_translations.english: having an uneven surface

detailed_translations.chinese: 粗糙, 未加工, 粗糙程度

sentences.english: So who are your real friends and whose real friends are you?
sentences.chinese: 而谁是你的真正的朋友，你又是谁的真正的朋友呢？

sentences.english: That’s the man whose house has burned down. ＃
sentences.chinese: 就是那个男人的房子被烧毁了。

detailed_translations.english: used to ask which person or people a particular thing belongs to

sentences.english: The troops will not advance until ordered to do so .
sentences.chinese: 在接到命令之前，部队不会前进。

sentences.english: Did Luke sell them? And, if so , what happened to the money?
sentences.chinese: 卢克把它们卖了吗？如果是这样的话，那钱到哪里去了？

sentences.english: ‘Has he lost a fortune?’ ‘ So they say .’
sentences.chinese: “他输掉了一大笔钱吗？”“他们是这么说的。”

sentences.english: ‘Look – I’ve even cleaned the windows.’ ‘ So I see .’
sentences.chinese: “瞧，我把窗子也擦干净了。”“我看到了。”

sentences.english: Parents can withdraw their child from school if they so wish .
sentences.chinese: 家长要是愿意，可以让孩子退学。

detailed_translations.english: used to refer back to an idea, action, quality, situation etc that has just been mentioned
used to say that someone does something because of the reason just stated

sentences.english: Their car was bigger and therefore more comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 他们的车大些，所以更舒适些。

sentences.english: Progress so far has been very good. We are, therefore, confident that the work will be completed on time.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止进展十分顺利，所以我们有把握按时完成工作。

detailed_translations.english: as a result of something that has just been mentioned

sentences.english: a beautifully detailed carving
sentences.chinese: 漂亮精致的雕刻

detailed_translations.english: containing or including a lot of information or details

sentences.english: German history
sentences.chinese: 德国历史

detailed_translations.english: relating to Germany, its people, or its language
someone from Germany

sentences.english: Germany borders on France.
sentences.chinese: 德国与法国接壤。

sentences.english: Bismarck ruled Germany by a strong hand.
sentences.chinese: 俾斯麦用铁腕手段统治德国。

sentences.english: The new Nazism is resurging in some places in Germany.
sentences.chinese: 新纳粹主义正在德国的一些地方复活。

sentences.english: In the dark of December.
sentences.chinese: 在十二月的黑夜里。

sentences.english: Our summers are short and our winters long.In December, when it is darkest, we only have a few hours of very weak sunlight per day.
sentences.chinese: 我们的夏天很短但是冬天很长，在十二月，也就是最黑的时候，我们的一天中只有很短的时间可以看到微弱的阳光。

sentences.english: I send out Valentine’s cards with the girls’ photo, instead of trying to mail cards in December.
sentences.chinese: ——我寄出有女孩子照片的情人节贺卡，以代替试图在十二月寄出的贺卡。

detailed_translations.english: the 12th month of the year, between November and January

sentences.english: He slid open the door of the glass cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 他滑开玻璃柜的门。

detailed_translations.english: to move smoothly over a surface while continuing to touch it, or to make something move in this way
to move smoothly over a surface while continuing to touch it, or to make something move in this way
a large structure with steps leading to the top of a long sloping surface which children can slide down

sentences.english: a diamond engagement ring
sentences.chinese: 订婚钻戒

detailed_translations.chinese: 钻石，金刚石；菱形；方块牌
detailed_translations.english: a clear, very hard valuable stone, used in jewellery and in industry

sentences.english: Hi, Kelly. How are you?
sentences.chinese: 嗨，凯利，你好吗？

sentences.english: You must all listen carefully.
sentences.chinese: 你们大家都必须仔细听着。

sentences.english: I have some news for you.
sentences.chinese: 我有一些消息要告诉你们。

sentences.english: The letter is addressed to both of you.
sentences.chinese: 信是寄给你们俩的。

sentences.english: Did Robin give you the money?
sentences.chinese: 罗宾把钱给你了吗？

sentences.english: Only you can make this decision.
sentences.chinese: 只有你才能作这个决定。

sentences.english: You idiot!
sentences.chinese: 你这个白痴！

sentences.english: You boys have got to learn to behave yourselves.
sentences.chinese: 你们这些男孩子必须学着规矩点。

sentences.english: Hey, you over there! Get out of the way!
sentences.chinese: 嘿，说你呢，让开！

detailed_translations.english: used to refer to a person or group of people when speaking or writing to them

detailed_translations.chinese: (You)人名；(柬)尤；(东南亚国家华语)猷

sentences.english: Believe in yourselves.
sentences.chinese: 相信你们自己。

sentences.english: I need not press the urgency of the matter on you, as I konw you are fully aware of it yourselves.
sentences.chinese: 我无需向你们强调此事的急迫性，因为我知道，你们自己对此完全了解。

sentences.english: But what is ultimately most important here is that you are asking the question —not just of me but of yourselves.
sentences.chinese: 但是我在这儿说的最重要的是：你们在问那些问题——不仅是问我，而是在问你们自己。

detailed_translations.chinese: 你们自己；你们本人（yourself的复数）

sentences.english: He was a painter and poet.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位画家兼诗人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who writes poems

sentences.english: He reads a lot of poetry.
sentences.chinese: 他大量阅读诗歌。

sentences.english: a poetry magazine
sentences.chinese: 诗歌杂志

detailed_translations.english: poems in general, or the art of writing them

sentences.english: a thick oak door
sentences.chinese: 一扇厚实的橡木门

sentences.english: a thick slice of homemade bread
sentences.chinese: 一片厚厚的自制面包

sentences.english: He was wearing thick glasses.
sentences.chinese: 他戴着厚厚的眼镜。

sentences.english: short thick fingers
sentences.chinese: 短粗的手指

sentences.english: thick wool socks (= socks that are heavy and warm )
sentences.chinese: 厚厚的羊毛袜子

sentences.english: If you want a thicker blanket, there are more here in the closet.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想要更厚的毯子，这个柜子里还有。

sentences.english: The meat is done when the thickest part turns from pink to white.
sentences.chinese: 肉最厚的部分从粉红色变成白色，就说明熟了。

detailed_translations.english: if something is thick, there is a large distance or a larger distance than usual between its two opposite surfaces or sides

sentences.english: The fog was beginning to thicken.
sentences.chinese: 雾气渐浓。

sentences.english: Thicken the soup by adding potatoes.
sentences.chinese: 加些马铃薯让汤变稠。

detailed_translations.english: to become thick, or make something thick

sentences.english: The thickness of the walls is 5 feet.
sentences.chinese: 墙体厚度为5英尺。

detailed_translations.english: how thick something is

sentences.chinese: 我们沿着一条狭窄的通道来到大楼的后面。

sentences.chinese: 地下通道

sentences.english: The bridge isn’t strong enough to allow the passage of heavy vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 那座桥不够坚固，无法让重型车辆通过。

detailed_translations.english: a way through something

sentences.english: The average American has not even thought about next year’s election.
sentences.chinese: 普通的美国人甚至还没有想过明年的选举。

sentences.english: In an average week I drive about 250 miles.
sentences.chinese: 平常我每周开车约250英里。

detailed_translations.english: having qualities that are typical of most people or things

sentences.english: The government will review the situation later in the year.
sentences.chinese: 政府将在今年晚些时候对形势重新加以研究。

sentences.english: The decision will be reviewed by the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 这个判决将由最高法院复核。

sentences.english: The team manager’s position will be reviewed at the end of the season.
sentences.chinese: 球队主教练的人选将在赛季末重新考虑。

sentences.english: If you have to cover 12 chapters in American history, begin by planning on three two-hour reviews with four chapters per session.
sentences.chinese: 如果你必须涵盖美国史的12个章节，首先计划3次2小时的复习，每次4章。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully examine or consider sth again, especially so that you can decide if it is necessary to make changes
(North Amercian English) a lesson in which you look again at sth you have studied, especially in order to prepare for an exam

sentences.english: Ice water is the only thing that really quenches my thirst (= gets rid of it ) .
sentences.chinese: 只有冰水才能让我真正解渴。

sentences.english: We had worked up a thirst (= done something that made us thirsty ) ，and so we decided to stop for a beer.
sentences.chinese: 我们干得口渴了，因此决定停下来喝杯啤酒。

sentences.english: Maggie woke up with a raging thirst (= an extremely strong thirst ) .
sentences.chinese: 玛吉醒来时感到口干舌燥。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of wanting or needing a drink
to be thirsty

sentences.english: Can I have a glass of water? I’m really thirsty.
sentences.chinese: 我能喝一杯水吗？ 我太渴了。

sentences.english: He’d been working in the garden and was very hot and thirsty.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在花园里干活，又热又渴。

sentences.english: All this digging is thirsty work (= work that makes you want a drink ) .
sentences.chinese: 这种挖地的活干了让人口渴。

detailed_translations.chinese: 口渴的，口干的；渴望的，热望的
detailed_translations.english: feeling that you want or need a drink

sentences.english: Why does the phone always ring when I’m in the shower?
sentences.chinese: 为什么电话铃总是在我洗澡的时候响？

sentences.english: I’d like to use the shower if that’s all right.
sentences.chinese: 如果可以的话，我想用一下这里的淋浴。

sentences.english: The bathroom has a separate shower cubicle (= a shower in a separate part of the room ) .
sentences.chinese: 卫生间里有一个独立的淋浴间。

sentences.english: I need a shower.
sentences.chinese: 我需要洗个淋浴。

sentences.english: Mike shaved and showered.
sentences.chinese: 迈克刮了脸，冲了个淋浴。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that you stand under to wash your whole body
to wash your whole body while standing under a shower

sentences.english: a dozen eggs
sentences.chinese: 一打鸡蛋

sentences.english: Chris, Helen, and half a dozen others went on holiday together.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯、海伦和其他六个人一起去度假了。

sentences.english: (= about 12 ) cars were parked near the entrance.
sentences.chinese: 入口附近停了大约十二辆汽车。

detailed_translations.english: twelve

sentences.english: A good strong cup of coffee is just what I need right now.
sentences.chinese: 我现在正需要喝一杯浓浓的咖啡。

sentences.english: The house was large and roomy; just right for us.
sentences.chinese: 那幢房子大而宽敞，正合我们的需要。

sentences.english: She looks just like her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她看上去就像她妈妈。

sentences.english: It’s nothing serious – just a small cut.
sentences.chinese: 不要紧，只不过是个小伤口。

sentences.english: John’s just told me that he’s getting married.
sentences.chinese: 约翰刚刚告诉我他要结婚了。

detailed_translations.english: exactly

sentences.english: Your arms should be at the same level as your desk.
sentences.chinese: 手臂应该与桌子齐平。

sentences.english: The floors in the old house were not completely level.
sentences.chinese: 老房子的地面不是完全平整的。

detailed_translations.english: the height of something in relation to the ground or to another object
flat and not sloping in any direction

sentences.english: The grassy plain gave way to an extensive swamp.
sentences.chinese: 青草覆盖的平原被广阔的沼泽地所取代。

sentences.english: the vast plains of central China
sentences.chinese: 华中地区的广阔平原

sentences.english: The advantages were plain to see.
sentences.chinese: 优势显而易见。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of flat dry land
very clear, and easy to understand or recognize

sentences.english: My mother and I are alike in many ways.
sentences.chinese: 我和母亲在许多方面很相似。

detailed_translations.english: very similar
used to emphasize that you mean both the people, groups, or things that you have just mentioned

sentences.english: Her skin felt smooth and cool.
sentences.chinese: 她的皮肤摸上去又滑又凉。

sentences.english: a smooth pebble
sentences.chinese: 光滑的卵石

sentences.english: The stone steps had been worn smooth .
sentences.chinese: 石阶被磨得光溜溜的了。

sentences.english: She stood up and smoothed down her frock.
sentences.chinese: 她站了起来，抚平了自己的连衣裙。

detailed_translations.english: a smooth surface has no rough parts, lumps, or holes, especially in a way that is pleasant and attractive to touch

detailed_translations.chinese: 使光滑；消除（障碍等）；使优雅；缓和
detailed_translations.english: to make a rough surface flat and even
If you smooth something, you move your hands over its surface to make it smooth and flat

sentences.english: She had never seen a real live elephant before.
sentences.chinese: 她以前从未见过活生生的大象。

sentences.english: a coat made of real fur
sentences.chinese: 真皮大衣

sentences.english: Things don’t happen quite that easily in real life.
sentences.chinese: 现实生活中不会动不动就有这样的事情发生。

detailed_translations.english: something that is real is actually what it seems to be and not false or artificial

sentences.english: He pulled a dirty handkerchief out by its corner and waved it at me.
sentences.chinese: 他拽出一块脏手帕，捏着一角向我挥动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 角落，拐角处；地区，偏僻处；困境，窘境
detailed_translations.english: the point at which two lines or edges meet

sentences.english: It’s very noble of you to spend all your weekends helping the old folk.
sentences.chinese: 你心地真好，周末的时间全都用来帮助老人。

sentences.english: noble ideals
sentences.chinese: 崇高的理想

detailed_translations.chinese: 高尚的；贵族的；惰性的；宏伟的
detailed_translations.english: morally good or generous in a way that is admired
a member of the highest social class with a title such as ‘Duke’ or ‘Countess’

sentences.english: It had once been the home of a wealthy nobleman.
sentences.chinese: 这曾是一个有钱贵族的宅邸。

detailed_translations.english: a man who is a member of the highest social class and has a title such as ‘Duke’

sentences.english: She has three daughters from a previous marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她前一次婚姻生了三个女儿。

sentences.english: The marriage took place at St Bartholomew’s Church.
sentences.chinese: 婚礼是在圣巴托罗缪教堂举行的。

detailed_translations.english: the relationship between two people who are married, or the state of being married

sentences.english: the former Soviet Union
sentences.chinese: 前苏联

sentences.english: Their farm has been reduced to half its former size.
sentences.chinese: 他们的农场已缩小到以前的一半。

sentences.english: Of the two possibilities, the former seems more likely.
sentences.chinese: 在这两种可能性中，前者似乎更有可能。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing before, but not now
the first of two people or things that you have just mentioned

sentences.english: a newly married couple
sentences.chinese: 一对新婚夫妇

sentences.english: the couple next door
sentences.chinese: 隔壁的那对夫妇

detailed_translations.english: two people who are married or having a sexual or romantic relationship

sentences.english: a politician of rare honesty and courage
sentences.chinese: 具备少见的诚实及勇气的政治家

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being honest

sentences.english: He was showered with honours – among them an Oscar.
sentences.chinese: 他获得了很多荣誉–其中包括奥斯卡奖。

detailed_translations.english: the respect that you, your family, your country etc receive from other people, which makes you feel proud

detailed_translations.chinese: 尊敬；[金融] 承兑；承兑远期票据
detailed_translations.english: to treat someone with special respect

sentences.english: He was a hard-working, honest man.
sentences.chinese: 他勤奋老实。

sentences.english: Ann had an honest face.
sentences.chinese: 安有一张诚实的面孔。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is honest always tells the truth and does not cheat or steal

sentences.english: Blackbirds lay their eggs in March.
sentences.chinese: 乌鸫在3月产蛋。

sentences.english: an ostrich egg
sentences.chinese: 鸵鸟蛋

sentences.english: The eggs hatch (= break open to allow the baby out ) in 26 days.
sentences.chinese: 这些蛋要26天才能孵化。

sentences.english: Joe always has bacon and egg for breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 乔早餐总是吃熏肉加蛋。

detailed_translations.english: a round object with a hard surface, that contains a baby bird, snake, insect etc and which is produced by a female bird, snake, insect etc

sentences.english: I have seen bricks amid the oak copse there.
sentences.chinese: 我还看见过橡树林中留存着的砖头。

sentences.english: Quietly he walked towards her, past her, and on towards the heavy oak door.
sentences.chinese: 轻轻地，他走向她，慢慢地，走过去，走向那沉重的橡树门。

detailed_translations.chinese: 栎树， 橡树， 橡木
detailed_translations.english: a large tree that is common in northern countries, or the hard wood of this tree

sentences.english: She got insanely jealous and there was a terrible fight.
sentences.chinese: 她变得过分地猜忌，接着是一场激烈的打斗。

detailed_translations.chinese: 妒忌的；猜疑的；唯恐失去的；戒备的
detailed_translations.english: feeling unhappy because someone has something that you wish you had

sentences.english: Sexual jealousy is a common motive for murder.
sentences.chinese: 性嫉妒是常见的谋杀动机。

sentences.english: feelings of professional jealousy
sentences.chinese: 职业上的嫉妒感

sentences.english: He quickly discovered the petty jealousies and gossip of village life.
sentences.chinese: 他很快就发现，在乡村生活中，人们狭隘善妒，喜欢传播流言蜚语。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being jealous

sentences.english: keen students
sentences.chinese: 求知若渴的学生

sentences.english: The kids in my class are all very keen.
sentences.chinese: 我班上的学生都很好学。

sentences.english: She was new in the job and keen as mustard (= very keen ).
sentences.chinese: 她刚开始做这工作，热情很高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热心的； 激烈的； 敏锐的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is keen is eager to work or learn, and enjoys doing it

sentences.english: The lack of a written constitution is a peculiarity of the British political system.
sentences.chinese: 没有一部成文宪法是英国政治制度的一大特点。

sentences.english: Margaret regarded her mother’s peculiarities with a fond tolerance.
sentences.chinese: 玛格丽特宽容地看待母亲的怪癖。

detailed_translations.english: something that is a feature of only one particular place, person, situation etc

sentences.english: He’s been a little peculiar lately.
sentences.chinese: 最近他有点怪异。

sentences.english: She’s a very peculiar child.
sentences.chinese: 她是个非常古怪的孩子。

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a strange and slightly crazy way

sentences.english: Much of the land was of poor quality.
sentences.chinese: 很多地的土质很差。

sentences.english: Use only high quality ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 只使用上等的材料。

sentences.english: the drug’s addictive quality
sentences.chinese: 毒品令人上瘾的特性

detailed_translations.english: how good or bad something is

sentences.english: The hotel is not responsible for any loss or damage to guests’ personal property .
sentences.chinese: 宾馆对住客个人财物的丢失和损坏概不负责。

sentences.english: Some of the stolen property was found in Mason’s house.
sentences.chinese: 在梅森家里找到了部分被盗财物。

detailed_translations.english: the thing or things that someone owns

sentences.english: The price of home ownership is increasing.
sentences.chinese: 房价在不断上涨。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of owning something

sentences.english: Spelling mistakes are often just the result of haste.
sentences.chinese: 拼写错误经常是由于匆忙而造成的。

sentences.english: And if haste is the accelerator pedal, multitasking is overdrive.
sentences.chinese: 如果匆忙是加速器的踏板，一心多用就是超速档。

sentences.english: My workmate gestured, clarifying his intentions of using a forged(faked) passport in haste.
sentences.chinese: 我的同事打着手势，匆忙地解释着他使用假护照的意图。

detailed_translations.chinese: 匆忙， 急速； 草率
detailed_translations.english: great speed in doing something, especially because you do not have enough time

sentences.english: If we hurry, we’ll get there in time.
sentences.chinese: 要是赶紧的话，我们能及时到那里。

sentences.english: I hate having to hurry a meal.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌匆匆忙忙地吃饭。

sentences.english: We’ll have to hurry, otherwise we’ll miss the start.
sentences.chinese: 我们得赶紧，否则就会错过开头部分了。

sentences.english: There’s no need to hurry. We’ve got plenty of time.
sentences.chinese: 不必匆忙，我们有的是时间。

detailed_translations.english: to do something or go somewhere more quickly than usual, especially because there is not much time
to make someone do something more quickly

sentences.english: In case of urgency, call the police.
sentences.chinese: 一旦发生紧急情况，打电话给警察。

sentences.english: I appreciate the sense of urgency because I feel it myself.
sentences.chinese: 我欣赏这种紧迫的感觉因为我自己就能体会到。

sentences.english: However pressing the need and urgency of the problem one should not proceed without a plausible plan.
sentences.chinese: 无论需要多么紧迫，问题多么紧急，一个人不能没有看似有理的计划就开始行动。

sentences.english: Their departure was hastened by an abnormally cold winter.
sentences.chinese: 那个冬天异常寒冷，所以他们提前走了。

detailed_translations.english: to make something happen faster or sooner

sentences.english: A small girl rushed past her.
sentences.chinese: 一个小女孩从她身边匆匆经过。

sentences.english: Mo rushed off down the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 莫匆匆走过走廊。

detailed_translations.english: to move very quickly, especially because you need to be somewhere very soon
to do or decide something too quickly, especially so that you do not have time to do it carefully or well

sentences.english: He soon regretted his hasty decision.
sentences.chinese: 他很快就对自己仓促作出的决定感到后悔了。

sentences.english: a hasty breakfast
sentences.chinese: 匆忙吃下的一顿早餐

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻率的；匆忙的；草率的；懈怠的
detailed_translations.english: done in a hurry, especially with bad results

sentences.english: He let down a bucket into the well to draw water.
sentences.chinese: 他把吊桶放进井里打水。

detailed_translations.english: an open container with a handle, used for carrying and holding things, especially liquids

sentences.english: We have a problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们遇到了一个麻烦。

sentences.english: There was a hole in the fence.
sentences.chinese: 篱笆上有一个洞。

sentences.english: Suddenly they heard a loud bang.
sentences.chinese: 他们突然听到砰的一声巨响。

sentences.english: I get paid once a month.
sentences.chinese: 我的工资一个月发一次。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that you are talking about someone or something that has not been mentioned before, or that your listener does not know about

sentences.english: an orange
sentences.chinese: 一个橘子

sentences.english: an X-ray
sentences.chinese: 一次X光检查

detailed_translations.english: used when the following word begins with a vowel sound

sentences.english: They had one daughter.
sentences.chinese: 他们有一个女儿。

sentences.english: one hundred and twenty-one pounds
sentences.chinese: 121英镑

sentences.english: Come back at one (= one o’clock ).
sentences.chinese: 1点钟回来。

sentences.english: Katie’s almost one (= one year old ).
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂快满一岁了。

sentences.english: The children seemed upset. One was crying.
sentences.chinese: 这些孩子好像不开心，有一个在哭。

detailed_translations.english: the number 1
used to refer to a member of a group or pair of people or things

sentences.english: Things have changed somewhat since then.
sentences.chinese: 从那时候起，情况就有些不一样了。

detailed_translations.english: more than a little but not very

sentences.english: Whereas if only I and a couple of other people like it, then it must be really something special.
sentences.chinese: 然而，如果只有我自己和几个别的什么人喜欢，那么它一定真的很特别了。

sentences.english: For instance, "in her family there were a couple of other queens and princesses that had atherosclerosis, so a genetic element cannot be excluded," Allam said.
sentences.chinese: 例如，奥勒姆说：”在她的家族里有两个皇后和两个公主患有动脉粥样硬化，所以基因是不能排除在外的因素。

sentences.english: We worked for a couple of weeks (off and on) and finally solved this problem.
sentences.chinese: 我工作了两个周（断断续续的）最终解决了这个问题。

sentences.english: The committee disinterred a few old studies done by the predecessors to prove their point.
sentences.chinese: 该委员会再现了由前任作的一些旧研究以证明他们的观点。

sentences.english: I’ve just made a pot of coffee. Would you like some?
sentences.chinese: 我刚煮了一壶咖啡，你想喝点吗？

sentences.english: ‘Do you know where the screws are?’ ‘There are some in the garage.’
sentences.chinese: “你知道螺丝钉在哪儿吗？”“车库里有一些。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 一些；某个；大约；相当多的
一些；若干；其中的一部分；（数量不确切时用）有些人
detailed_translations.english: a number of people or things or an amount of something, when the exact number or amount is not stated
a fairly large number or amount of something

sentences.english: With a little care you could have avoided the mishap.
sentences.chinese: 你要是小心一点， 本来是可以避免这场不测之祸的。

sentences.english: Susan and Robert kissed each other passionately.
sentences.chinese: 苏珊和罗伯特深情地亲吻。

sentences.english: The girls looked at each other.
sentences.chinese: 女孩们互相看了看。

sentences.english: They enjoy each other’s company.
sentences.chinese: 他俩很喜欢待在一起。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that each of two or more people does something to the other or others

sentences.english: Liz and I have known one another for years.
sentences.chinese: 我和利兹相识有好多年了。

sentences.english: They often stay at one another’s houses.
sentences.chinese: 他们经常住在彼此的家里。

detailed_translations.english: each other

sentences.english: Burglars broke into their home.
sentences.chinese: 窃贼闯进了他们家。

detailed_translations.english: someone who goes into houses, shops etc to steal things

sentences.english: When we looked around the school we got a very good impression.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了学校，对它的印象很好。

sentences.english: I got the impression that she wasn’t very happy with her job.
sentences.chinese: 我有这样的印象，她的工作干得并不愉快。

sentences.english: Some of the fallen trees had left a clear impression in the hardened mud.
sentences.chinese: 有一些倒下的树木在坚硬的泥地上留下了清晰的压痕。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion or feeling you have about someone or something because of the way they seem

name: draw a line through a point
trans: eine Linie durch einen Punkt ziehen

sentences.english: There is an active Society which brings to book a good many parents who starve and torture and overwork their children, and intimidates a good many more.
sentences.chinese: 一个很积极的社会记录了许多父母是怎样让自己的孩子忍饥挨饿，折磨他们，让他们过度工作，对他们愈加 恐吓的。

sentences.english: I've seen a good many little girls in my time, but never ONE with such a neck as that!
sentences.chinese: 鸽子十分轻蔑地说，“我这辈子看见过许多小姑娘，可从来没有一个长着像你这样的长脖子的！

sentences.english: I will not burden you with a lot of questions.
sentences.chinese: 我不会提许多问题来烦扰你的。

sentences.english: If the Workers' Party comes in at the next election a lot of industry will be stateowned.
sentences.chinese: 如果工党能在下次大选登台执政的话，许多工业将变为国有企业。

sentences.english: Their car broke down.
sentences.chinese: 他们的车抛锚了。

detailed_translations.english: If a machine or a vehicle breaks down, it stops working.

sentences.english: A pretty scarf was loosely knotted around her neck.
sentences.chinese: 她的脖子上松松地系着一条漂亮的围巾。

detailed_translations.english: to tie together two ends or pieces of string, rope, cloth etc
a hard round place in a piece of wood where a branch once joined the tree
to tie together two ends or pieces of string, rope, cloth etc

name: drive a nail into the wall
trans: einen Nagel in die Wand schlagen

name: enter a name on a list
trans: einen Namen auf einer Liste eintragen

sentences.chinese: 新当选的总统紧随其后，坐着6匹灰色骏马开道的敞篷马车。

sentences.chinese: 不，尽管这种纸里75％的原料都是大象的粪便，但它不但不臭，反而有一种淡淡的清香，这是源于它的特殊的制造工艺。
