sentences.english: a working model (= one with parts which move ) of a steam engine
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽机车的活动模型

sentences.english: a top fashion model
sentences.chinese: 顶级时装模特

detailed_translations.english: a small copy of a building, vehicle, machine etc, especially one that can be put together from separate parts

sentences.english: Such companies must change if they are to compete in the modern world .
sentences.chinese: 此类公司如果想在现代社会中与别人竞争，就必须有所改变。

sentences.english: They are the youngest children in modern times to face murder charges.
sentences.chinese: 他们是近代面临谋杀指控儿童中年龄最小的。

sentences.english: Smaller families are a feature of modern society .
sentences.chinese: 家庭规模变小是现代社会的一个特征。

sentences.english: Computers are an essential part of modern life .
sentences.chinese: 电脑是现代生活必不可少的组成部分。

sentences.english: a book about modern history
sentences.chinese: 一本关于现代史的书

sentences.english: The original supermarkets were small by modern standards.
sentences.chinese: 最初的超级市场按现代的标准来看是很小的。

detailed_translations.english: belonging to the present time or most recent time

sentences.english: ...the most up-to-date information available on foods today.
sentences.chinese: …今日有关食品的最新消息。

detailed_translations.chinese: 直到最近的， 现代的； 跟上时代的
detailed_translations.english: modern or fashionable

sentences.english: They need more funds to modernize the country’s telephone system.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要更多的资金将本国的电话系统现代化。

sentences.english: a tastefully modernized old farmhouse
sentences.chinese: 雅致而现代化的旧农舍

detailed_translations.english: to make something such as a system or building more modern

sentences.english: Strong colours are very fashionable at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 眼下流行艳丽的色彩。

detailed_translations.english: popular, especially for a short period of time

sentences.english: Is it possible to get tickets for the game?
sentences.chinese: 有没有可能弄到比赛的门票？

sentences.english: It might be possible for the documents to be sent over.
sentences.chinese: 这些文件也许可以发送过去。

sentences.english: Computer technology makes it possible for many people to work from home.
sentences.chinese: 计算机技术让很多人可以在家里工作。

sentences.english: I want to avoid the rush hour traffic if possible .
sentences.chinese: 如有可能我想避开交通高峰时间。

sentences.english: I walk or use public transport whenever possible .
sentences.chinese: 只要有可能我就步行或者乘坐公共交通工具。

sentences.english: We are doing everything possible to track down the killer.
sentences.chinese: 我们正竭尽全力追捕杀人凶手。

sentences.english: Our staff will help you in every way possible .
sentences.chinese: 我们的员工会尽力帮助你。

sentences.english: Even if it were technically possible , we do not have the money to do it.
sentences.chinese: 即使技术上可行，我们也没有钱去做。

sentences.english: She decided to stay as far away from him as was humanly possible .
sentences.chinese: 她决定尽可能离他远点。

detailed_translations.english: if something is possible, it can be done or achieved

sentences.english: There were several possibilities open to each manufacturer.
sentences.chinese: 每个制造商都可以有几种不同的选择。

detailed_translations.english: A possibility is one of several different things that could be done.

sentences.english: grated carrots
sentences.chinese: 磨碎的胡萝卜

sentences.english: carrot juice
sentences.chinese: 胡萝卜汁

detailed_translations.english: a long pointed orange vegetable that grows under the ground

sentences.english: In my childhood, local dairies bought milk from local farmers.
sentences.chinese: 在我小时候，本地的乳品公司向当地农场主收购牛奶。

sentences.english: dairy products/produce
sentences.chinese: 乳制品；奶类产品

detailed_translations.english: a place on a farm where milk is kept and butter and cheese are made
made from milk

sentences.english: I hope I’ll have finished the work by the end of the month.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我这个月底能完成工作。

sentences.english: She earns about £350 a month (= each month ).
sentences.chinese: 她每月约挣350英镑。

sentences.english: We update the schedule at least once a month.
sentences.chinese: 我们至少每月更新一次日程表。

detailed_translations.english: one of the 12 named periods of time that a year is divided into

sentences.english: The mortgage is payable in monthly instalments.
sentences.chinese: 抵押贷款每月分期偿还。

sentences.english: a monthly publication
sentences.chinese: 月刊

sentences.english: In some areas the property price can rise monthly.
sentences.chinese: 有些地区，房价能每月都涨。

sentences.english: They meet monthly to discuss progress.
sentences.chinese: 他们每月碰一次头讨论进展情况。

sentences.english: a leading women’s monthly
sentences.chinese: 一本主要的女性月刊

detailed_translations.english: happening once a month
every month or once a month
a magazine that appears once a month

sentences.english: the craters on the surface of the moon
sentences.chinese: 月球表面的环形山

sentences.english: The Americans landed on the Moon in 1969.
sentences.chinese: 美国人于1969年登上月球。

sentences.english: The moon appeared from behind a cloud.
sentences.chinese: 月亮从云后钻了出来。

sentences.english: The moon rose into the sky.
sentences.chinese: 月亮升上天空。

sentences.english: The moon was shining in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 月儿当空照。

sentences.english: the moons of Saturn
sentences.chinese: 土星的卫星

detailed_translations.english: the round object that you can see shining in the sky at night, and that moves around the Earth every 28 days

sentences.english: The president announced Monday that he would cancel the debt.
sentences.chinese: 总统周一宣布他会取消这笔债务。

detailed_translations.english: the day between Sunday and Tuesday

sentences.english: It is easy to have an opinion on a moral issue like the death penalty for murder.
sentences.chinese: 对于判谋杀犯死刑这种涉及伦理道德的问题，有个观点并非难事。

sentences.english: If we accept that certain babies should be allowed to die, we place doctors in a moral dilemma .
sentences.chinese: 如果我们同意应该允许某些婴儿死去，那就是让医生在道德上处于两难境地了。

sentences.english: Man is gifted with a moral sense by which he distinguishes good from evil.
sentences.chinese: 人类天生有道德意识，能区分善与恶。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the principles of what is right and wrong behaviour, and with the difference between good and evil

detailed_translations.chinese: 品行， 道德规范； 寓意
detailed_translations.english: principles or standards of good behaviour, especially in matters of sex

sentences.english: I hated those cold winter mornings.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌冬天里寒冷的早晨。

sentences.english: I’m not feeling very well this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上我觉得不大舒服。

sentences.english: He stayed in bed late on Sunday morning.
sentences.chinese: 星期日早上他睡到很晚。

sentences.english: She took the early morning train.
sentences.chinese: 她搭乘了一大早的火车。

detailed_translations.english: the early part of the day, from when the sun rises until 12 o’clock in the middle of the day

sentences.english: I’ll see you at tomorrow’s meeting.
sentences.chinese: 明天会上见。

detailed_translations.english: the day after today
on or during the day after today

sentences.english: an electric motor
sentences.chinese: 电动马达

sentences.english: That’s a nice motor you’ve got, Dave.
sentences.chinese: 你这车不错啊，戴夫。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a machine that makes it work or move, by changing power, especially electrical power, into movement

sentences.english: You'd better encash your motorcycle at once.
sentences.chinese: 你最好马上卖掉摩托车换成现款。

sentences.english: She can ride a motorcycle， to say nothing of a bicycle.
sentences.chinese: 她摩托车都会骑， 自行车更不在话下了。

sentences.english: He runs behind a motorcycle for half an hour every morning.
sentences.chinese: 他每天早晨跟在摩托车后面跑半个小时。

detailed_translations.english: a fast two-wheeled vehicle with an engine

sentences.english: He looks tired out (= very tired ) .
sentences.chinese: 他看起来累坏了。

sentences.english: ‘No,’ Frank said in a tired voice.
sentences.chinese: “不。”弗兰克语带疲倦地说。

detailed_translations.english: feeling that you want to sleep or rest

detailed_translations.chinese: 疲倦；对…腻烦（tire的过去分词形式）

sentences.english: All our flours are milled using traditional methods.
sentences.chinese: 我们所有的面粉全是用传统方法碾磨的。

sentences.english: Add some freshly milled black pepper.
sentences.chinese: 加一些现磨的黑胡椒粉。

detailed_translations.english: to crush grain, pepper etc in a mill

detailed_translations.chinese: 磨坊；碾磨机；制造厂，工厂
detailed_translations.english: a building containing a large machine for crushing grain into flour

sentences.english: There will be simple tests in addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
sentences.chinese: 将会有加减乘除的简单测试。

sentences.english: a multiplication of the number of forms to fill out
sentences.chinese: 需要填写的表格数量的倍增

detailed_translations.english: a method of calculating in which you add a number to itself a particular number of times

sentences.english: Children will learn to multiply in the second grade.
sentences.chinese: 儿童在二年级学习乘法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘；使增加；使繁殖；使相乘
detailed_translations.english: to do a calculation in which you add a number to itself a particular number of times

sentences.english: He lifted his glass to his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 他把玻璃杯举到嘴边。

sentences.english: Liam was fast asleep with his mouth wide open.
sentences.chinese: 利亚姆大张着嘴，睡得很熟。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your face which you put food into, or which you use for speaking

sentences.english: Toss a coin to see who goes first.
sentences.chinese: 抛硬币决定谁先来。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of metal, usually flat and round, that is used as money
to make pieces of money from metal

sentences.english: All passengers must wear seat belts.
sentences.chinese: 所有乘客都必须系安全带。

sentences.english: It’s getting late. I really must go.
sentences.chinese: 天晚了，我真的必须走了。

sentences.english: You must work hard.
sentences.chinese: 你必须努力工作。

sentences.english: We must all be patient.
sentences.chinese: 我们都必须耐心。

sentences.english: Must I pay now?
sentences.chinese: 我必须现在付款吗？

sentences.english: For the engine to work, the green lever must be in the ‘up’ position.
sentences.chinese: 要启动引擎，绿色操纵杆必须在“上”这一挡。

sentences.english: Accidents must be reported to the safety officer.
sentences.chinese: 出了事故必须向安全员报告。

detailed_translations.english: to have to do something because it is necessary or important, or because of a law or order

sentences.english: Most people now enjoy shorter working hours and more leisure time.
sentences.chinese: 现在大多数人都喜欢工作时间短些，闲暇时间多些。

sentences.english: Watching television is now the nation’s most popular leisure activity.
sentences.chinese: 看电视是当前国民最普遍的消遣活动。

sentences.english: The hotel offers various leisure facilities such as a swimming pool and sauna.
sentences.chinese: 酒店提供游泳池、桑拿浴室等各种休闲设施。

sentences.english: The leisure industry (= the business of providing leisure activities ) is now an important part of the economy.
sentences.chinese: 现在休闲娱乐行业是经济的一个重要组成部分。

detailed_translations.english: time when you are not working or studying and can relax and do things you enjoy

sentences.english: the Museum of Modern Art
sentences.chinese: 现代艺术博物馆

sentences.english: The museum has an extensive collection of early photographs.
sentences.chinese: 这座博物馆藏有大量早期的照片。

detailed_translations.english: a building where important  cultural, historical, or scientific objects are kept and shown to the public

sentences.english: After a period of enforced idleness, she found a new job.
sentences.chinese: 她在被迫闲散了一段时间之后，找到了份新工作。

sentences.english: I often listen to classic music when I’m in the car.
sentences.chinese: 我在车上经常听古典音乐。

sentences.english: A new piece of music was specially written for the occasion.
sentences.chinese: 为了这个活动专门写了一首新曲子。

sentences.english: I left my music at home.
sentences.chinese: 我把乐谱落在家里了。

detailed_translations.english: a series of sounds made by instruments or voices in a way that is pleasant or exciting

sentences.english: a musical version of the fairy tale ‘Cinderella’
sentences.chinese: 童话故事《灰姑娘》的音乐剧版

sentences.english: When he began his musical career, King played only for black audiences.
sentences.chinese: 金在音乐事业的开始阶段只为黑人观众演奏。

detailed_translations.english: relating to music or consisting of music

sentences.english: a talented young musician
sentences.chinese: 有天赋的年轻音乐家

detailed_translations.english: a person who plays a musical instrument or writes music, especially as a job

sentences.english: The band was playing old Beatles songs.
sentences.chinese: 乐队正在演奏披头士的老歌。

sentences.english: I grew up playing in rock bands.
sentences.chinese: 我是在摇滚乐队里玩音乐长大的。

sentences.english: Smith joined the band in 1989.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯在1989年加入这个乐队。

sentences.english: They formed a band when they were still at school.
sentences.chinese: 他们还在读书的时候就组建了一个乐队。

sentences.english: The entertainment includes a disco and live band .
sentences.chinese: 娱乐活动有跳迪斯科和乐队现场演奏。

sentences.english: interviews with band members
sentences.chinese: 对乐队成员的采访

detailed_translations.english: a group of musicians, especially a group that plays popular music

sentences.english: Relax your stomach muscles , then stretch again.
sentences.chinese: 放松腹部肌肉，然后再绷紧。

sentences.english: Regular exercise will help to strengthen your muscles .
sentences.chinese: 经常锻炼有助于强健肌肉。

sentences.english: It took muscle to work in an old-fashioned kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 在老式厨房里干活很费力。

detailed_translations.english: one of the pieces of flesh inside your body that you use in order to move, and that connect your bones together

sentences.english: Weather patterns have changed in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 气候模式近年已经发生了变化。

sentences.english: A general pattern began to emerge .
sentences.chinese: 一个总体模式开始显现。

sentences.english: Their descriptions seemed to follow a set pattern (= always develop in the same way ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的描述似乎依据固定的模式。

sentences.english: His behavior fits a pattern of violent acts.
sentences.chinese: 他的举动符合暴力行为的模式。

sentences.english: a dress pattern
sentences.chinese: 连衣裙的纸样

detailed_translations.english: the regular way in which something happens, develops, or is done

sentences.english: They took a blood sample to test for hepatitis.
sentences.chinese: 他们取了血样做肝炎化验。

detailed_translations.english: a small part or amount of something that is examined in order to find out something about the whole

detailed_translations.chinese: 从…抽样； 品尝， 体验
detailed_translations.english: to taste food or drink in order to see what it is like

sentences.english: Sue showed great courage throughout her illness.
sentences.chinese: 休在生病期间表现出了极大的勇气。

sentences.english: Driving again after his accident must have taken a lot of courage (= needed courage ) .
sentences.chinese: 他出事故后再驾车肯定需要很大的勇气。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being brave when you are facing a difficult or dangerous situation or when you are very ill

sentences.english: He was wrong, and courageous enough to admit it.
sentences.chinese: 他是错了，而且有勇气承认自己错了。

sentences.english: a courageous decision
sentences.chinese: 勇敢的决定

detailed_translations.english: brave

sentences.english: a daring rescue attempt
sentences.chinese: 大胆的营救行动

detailed_translations.english: involving a lot of risk or danger, or brave enough to do risky things
courage that makes you willing to take risks

sentences.english: His mother and father are both doctors.
sentences.chinese: 他的父母都是医生。

sentences.english: the relationship between mother and child
sentences.chinese: 母亲和孩子之间的关系

sentences.english: Goodnight, Mother.
sentences.chinese: 晚安，妈妈。

sentences.english: Mother said they’d met at university.
sentences.chinese: 母亲说他们是在大学里认识的。

sentences.english: If food is scarce, the mother will feed the smaller, weaker chicks.
sentences.chinese: 如果食物稀少，母禽就喂较小、较弱的幼禽。

detailed_translations.english: a female parent of a child or animal

sentences.english: a baseball cap
sentences.chinese: 棒球帽

sentences.english: a bottle cap
sentences.chinese: 瓶盖

sentences.english: a graceful tower capped with a golden dome
sentences.chinese: 一座漂亮的金色圆顶塔

detailed_translations.english: a type of flat hat that has a curved part sticking out at the front, and is often worn as part of a uniform
to have a particular substance on top

sentences.english: A strong gust of wind blew the car sideways into the ditch.
sentences.chinese: 一阵狂风把汽车横着掀进了沟里。

sentences.english: Alfred shot him a sideways glance.
sentences.chinese: 艾尔弗雷德斜着眼看了他一下。

detailed_translations.english: to or towards one side
Sideways is also an adjective

sentences.english: She was a splendid mimic and loved to imitate Winston Churchill.
sentences.chinese: 她是个出色的模仿者，喜欢模仿温斯顿·丘吉尔。

sentences.english: The Japanese have no wish to imitate Western social customs and attitudes.
sentences.chinese: 日本人无意仿效西方的社会习俗和处事态度。

detailed_translations.english: to copy the way someone behaves, speaks, moves etc, especially in order to make people laugh

sentences.english: The remake of ‘Casablanca’ was a pale imitation (= something that is much less good than the thing it imitates ) of the original movie.
sentences.chinese: 重拍的《卡萨布兰卡》远不如原版。

sentences.english: ...a complete set of Dickens bound in imitation leather.
sentences.chinese: …用人造革装帧的一整套《狄更斯全集》。

detailed_translations.english: when you copy someone else’s actions
Imitation things are not genuine but are made to look as if they are

sentences.english: One of the neighbors complained about the noise from the party.
sentences.chinese: 有位邻居抱怨聚会太吵。

sentences.english: FBI agents were interviewing all their friends and neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 联邦调查局人员正在向他们所有的朋友和邻居问话。

sentences.english: Our next-door neighbours (= the people who live in the house next to us ) say they’ll look after our cat for us while we’re away.
sentences.chinese: 我们隔壁的邻居说，我们不在时他们会照顾我们的猫。

detailed_translations.english: someone who lives next to you or near you

sentences.english: Be quiet! You’ll wake up the whole neighbourhood!
sentences.chinese: 安静点！ 你会把邻居全都吵醒的！

sentences.english: She grew up in a quiet neighborhood of Boston.
sentences.chinese: 她是在波士顿一个清静的街区里长大的。

detailed_translations.english: the area around you or around a particular place, or the people who live there

sentences.english: He set out several principles that he hopes will guide his successors.
sentences.chinese: 他制定出了几条原则,希望能指导其继任者。

detailed_translations.english: Someone's successor is the person who takes their job after they have left

sentences.english: I pressed my parents until they finally gave in and registered me for skating classes.
sentences.chinese: 我一直催着父母，直到他们最终让步给我报了名上溜冰课。

detailed_translations.english: If you give in, you agree to do something that you do not want to do

sentences.english: Charles arrived shortly afterwards .
sentences.chinese: 过了不多久，查尔斯来了。

sentences.english: She died not long afterwards .
sentences.chinese: 不久以后她去世了。

sentences.english: Afterwards, I was asked to write a book.
sentences.chinese: 后来，有人要我写一本书。

detailed_translations.english: after an event or time that has already been mentioned

sentences.english: There’s a meeting on Thursday afternoon .
sentences.chinese: 星期四下午有个会议。

sentences.english: It was very hot in the afternoon .
sentences.chinese: 下午很热。

sentences.english: See you tomorrow afternoon .
sentences.chinese: 明天下午见。

sentences.english: Are you going into town this afternoon ?
sentences.chinese: 今天下午你进城去吗？

sentences.english: We met in the early afternoon .
sentences.chinese: 下午较早的时候我们见了面。

sentences.english: By late afternoon , Micky had changed his mind.
sentences.chinese: 到了傍晚，米基已改变了主意。

sentences.english: He was having his afternoon nap .
sentences.chinese: 他在睡午觉。

detailed_translations.english: the part of the day after the morning and before the evening

sentences.english: a late evening news broadcast
sentences.chinese: 晚间新闻节目

sentences.english: I hope to have some good news for you soon.
sentences.chinese: 我希望很快就能给你好消息。

detailed_translations.english: reports of recent events in the newspapers or on the radio or television

sentences.english: I looked your address up in the personnel file.
sentences.chinese: 我从人事档案里查到了你的地址。

detailed_translations.english: If you look up a fact or a piece of information, you find it out by looking in something such as a reference book or a list

sentences.english: The next six months will be the hardest.
sentences.chinese: 接下来的六个月将是最难熬的。

sentences.english: The man in the next chair was asleep.
sentences.chinese: 邻座的男子睡着了。

detailed_translations.english: coming straight after sb/sth in time, order or space

sentences.english: It was a cold moonlit night.
sentences.chinese: 那是个寒冷的月夜。

sentences.english: I didn’t sleep too well last night.
sentences.chinese: 我昨晚睡得不太好。

detailed_translations.english: the dark part of each 24-hour period when the sun cannot be seen and when most people sleep

sentences.english: Criminal behaviour can be linked to economic disadvantage.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪行为可能会与经济困难有关。

detailed_translations.english: something that causes problems, or that makes someone or something less likely to be successful or effective

sentences.english: a ragged child with bare feet
sentences.chinese: 一个衣衫褴褛、光着脚的小孩

sentences.english: She felt the sun warm on her bare arms.
sentences.chinese: 她感觉到阳光照在她裸露双臂上的暖意。

sentences.english: He got 40% – a bare pass.
sentences.chinese: 他得了40分，勉强及格。

detailed_translations.english: not covered by clothes

sentences.english: The key was hanging on a nail by the door.
sentences.chinese: 钥匙挂在门边的一颗钉子上。

sentences.english: Stop biting your nails!
sentences.chinese: 别咬指甲！

sentences.english: A sign saying ‘No Fishing’ had been nailed to the tree.
sentences.chinese: 树上钉着一块写有“禁止钓鱼”的牌子。

detailed_translations.english: a thin pointed piece of metal with a flat top, which you hit into a surface with a hammer, for example to join things together or to hang something on
to fasten something to something else with nails

sentences.english: A lot of the buildings are built very close to each other.＃
sentences.chinese: 很多建筑建造的彼此非常接近。

detailed_translations.english: almost; nearly

sentences.english: She carried hypodermic needles and syringes in her bag.
sentences.chinese: 她包里带着皮下注射针和针筒。

sentences.english: Drug users are at risk when they share needles.
sentences.chinese: 吸毒者共用注射针很危险。

detailed_translations.english: a very thin, pointed steel tube at the end of a syringe, which is pushed into your skin to put a drug or medicine into your body or to take out blood

sentences.english: A certain person, who shall remain nameless, forgot to lock the front door.
sentences.chinese: 某人忘了锁前门，名字我就不说了。

detailed_translations.english: used when you want to say that someone has done something wrong but without mentioning their name, especially to criticize them in a friendly way

sentences.english: Three students were mentioned, namely John, Sarah and Sylvia.
sentences.chinese: 有三名学生被提到，即约翰、萨拉和西尔维娅。

detailed_translations.english: used when saying the names of the people or things you are referring to

sentences.english: What a fool she had been to think that he would stay.
sentences.chinese: 她竟然那么傻，以为他会留下来。

sentences.english: Like a fool, I accepted straight away.
sentences.chinese: 我像个傻子，立刻就接受了。

sentences.english: You silly old fool !
sentences.chinese: 你这个大傻瓜！

sentences.english: Even art experts were fooled.
sentences.chinese: 连艺术品专家也被骗了。

detailed_translations.english: a stupid person or someone who has done something stupid
to trick someone into believing something that is not true

sentences.english: I’ve washed your shirt but it’s still wet.
sentences.chinese: 我把你的衬衫洗过了，不过现在还是湿的。

sentences.english: wet grass
sentences.chinese: 湿草地

sentences.english: The man in the boat was wet through (= completely wet ).
sentences.chinese: 船上的那人浑身湿透。

detailed_translations.english: covered in or full of water or another liquid
the rain
to make something wet

sentences.english: Someone punched him on the nose.
sentences.chinese: 有人一拳打在他的鼻子上。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a person’s or animal’s face used for smelling or breathing

sentences.english: the President’s radio broadcast to the nation
sentences.chinese: 总统对全国的广播讲话

sentences.english: an independent nation
sentences.chinese: 独立的国家

sentences.english: the world’s leading industrial nations
sentences.chinese: 世界上的主要工业国

sentences.english: the Cherokee nation
sentences.chinese: 切罗基族

detailed_translations.english: a country, considered especially in relation to its people and its social or economic structure

sentences.english: Religion matters very much at a national level.
sentences.chinese: 宗教事务在全国都非常重要。

sentences.english: Between 1929 and 1933 America’s national income fell by more than half.
sentences.chinese: 1929至1933年间，美国的国民收入下降过半。

sentences.english: There are strong indications that the Prime Minister will call national elections in May.
sentences.chinese: 有明显迹象预示首相将于5月召集全国大选。

detailed_translations.english: related to a whole nation as opposed to any of its parts

sentences.english: We grew up in the countryside, surrounded by the beauties of nature.
sentences.chinese: 我们在乡村长大，周围是美丽的大自然。

sentences.english: nature conservation
sentences.chinese: 自然保护

sentences.english: Disease is nature’s way of keeping the population down.
sentences.chinese: 疾病是大自然控制人口的方法。

sentences.english: I tried appealing to his better nature (= his feelings of kindness ) but he wouldn’t agree to help us.
sentences.chinese: 我想唤起他的善良本性，但他就是不同意帮助我们。

sentences.english: Capitalist society is by its very nature unstable.
sentences.chinese: 从本质而言，资本主义社会是不稳定的。

detailed_translations.english: everything in the physical world that is not controlled by humans, such as wild plants and animals, earth and rocks, and the weather

sentences.english: the study of the natural world
sentences.chinese: 对自然界的研究

sentences.english: an area of spectacular natural beauty
sentences.chinese: 自然风景秀丽的地区

sentences.english: death from natural causes
sentences.chinese: 自然死亡

sentences.english: the need for natural light in offices
sentences.chinese: 办公室里需要自然光的照射

detailed_translations.english: existing in nature and not caused, made, or controlled by people

sentences.english: It will be a cold night, and there may be fog patches .
sentences.chinese: 今夜天气寒冷，部分地区可能有雾。

sentences.english: A blanket of fog covered the fields.
sentences.chinese: 大雾笼罩了田野。

sentences.english: The fog lifted (= disappeared ) in the afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 下午，雾散了。

detailed_translations.english: cloudy air near the ground which is difficult to see through

detailed_translations.chinese: 使模糊；使困惑；以雾笼罩
detailed_translations.english: if something made of glass fogs or becomes fogged, it becomes covered in small drops of water that make it difficult to see through

sentences.english: Wendy came up and sat beside me.
sentences.chinese: 温迪走过来，坐在我身边。

sentences.english: the table beside the bed
sentences.chinese: 床边的桌子

sentences.english: I was standing right beside her at the time.
sentences.chinese: 当时我就站在她的旁边。

detailed_translations.english: next to or very close to the side of someone or something

sentences.english: I am planning a 25th birthday party for my nephew.
sentences.chinese: 我正在为侄子筹划他25岁的生日聚会。

detailed_translations.english: the son of your brother or sister, or the son of your husband’s or wife’s brother or sister

sentences.english: envious looks
sentences.chinese: 妒忌的神色

detailed_translations.english: wanting something that someone else has

sentences.english: We all tend to like those similar to us.
sentences.chinese: 我们都倾向于喜欢一些像我们的人。

sentences.english: his radical political leanings
sentences.chinese: 他那激进的政治倾向

detailed_translations.english: a tendency to prefer or agree with a particular set of beliefs, opinions etc

sentences.english: a condition which affects the nerves in the back
sentences.chinese: 影响背部神经的疾病

sentences.english: She finally found the nerve to tell him she wanted a divorce.
sentences.chinese: 她终于鼓起勇气告诉他自己想离婚。

detailed_translations.english: nerves are parts inside your body which look like threads and carry messages between the brain and other parts of the body

sentences.english: I wish you’d stop looking at me like that. You’re making me nervous.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你不要再那样看着我了，你让我紧张。

sentences.english: By the time I got into the interview I was a nervous wreck (= was extremely nervous ).
sentences.chinese: 到了面试的时候，我紧张得要命。

detailed_translations.english: worried or frightened about something, and unable to relax

detailed_translations.chinese: 神经质；[心理] 神经过敏；紧张不安

sentences.english: a bird’s nest
sentences.chinese: 鸟窝

sentences.english: In May the females build a nest and lay their eggs.
sentences.chinese: 雌鸟在5月份筑巢产蛋。

sentences.english: Young eagles leave the nest after only two months.
sentences.chinese: 雏鹰仅仅两个月以后就会飞离鸟巢。

detailed_translations.english: a place made or chosen by a bird to lay its eggs in and to live in
to build or use a nest

sentences.english: We netted three fish in under an hour.
sentences.chinese: 不到一小时我们就网住了三条鱼。

detailed_translations.english: to catch sth, especially fish, in a net

sentences.english: Hungary’s telephone network
sentences.chinese: 匈牙利的电话网

sentences.english: a high-speed European rail network
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的高速铁路网

sentences.english: the network of blood vessels in the body
sentences.chinese: 人体内的血管网

detailed_translations.english: a system of lines, tubes, wires, roads etc that cross each other and are connected to each other

sentences.english: the city’s new hospital
sentences.chinese: 市里新建的医院

sentences.english: the new issue of ‘Time’ magazine
sentences.chinese: 新一期《时代周刊》

sentences.english: new products on the market
sentences.chinese: 市场上的新产品

sentences.english: The hardest part of this job is understanding the new technology.
sentences.chinese: 这项工作最难的地方是理解新技术。

sentences.english: a young man with new ideas
sentences.chinese: 一个有新观念的年轻人

detailed_translations.english: recently made, built, invented, written, designed etc

sentences.english: He telephoned me the latest news.
sentences.chinese: 他打电话告诉我最新的消息。

sentences.english: His latest novel was cut up by the reviewers.
sentences.chinese: 他的最新小说被评论家批得体无完肤。

sentences.english: In order to prove his point he showed them the latest sales figures.
sentences.chinese: 为了证明他的观点，他给他们看了最新的销售数字。

detailed_translations.english: the most recent or newest thing

detailed_translations.chinese: 最新的，最近的；最迟的，最后的
detailed_translations.english: the most recent or the newest

sentences.english: I opened the packet just to satisfy my curiosity .
sentences.chinese: 我打开包裹只是为了满足我的好奇心。

sentences.english: The news aroused a lot of curiosity among local people.
sentences.chinese: 这条消息在当地人中间引起了很大的好奇心。

sentences.english: She decided to follow him out of curiosity .
sentences.chinese: 她出于好奇决定跟踪他。

sentences.english: Margaret looked at him with curiosity .
sentences.chinese: 玛格丽特好奇地看着他。

sentences.english: a man of immense intellectual curiosity
sentences.chinese: 求知欲极强的一个男人

sentences.english: It was idle curiosity that made me ask.
sentences.chinese: 我只是好奇地随便问了一下。

detailed_translations.english: the desire to know about something

sentences.english: Puppies are naturally curious.
sentences.chinese: 小狗天生好奇。

sentences.english: He felt a curious mixture of excitement and panic.
sentences.chinese: 他有一种既兴奋又惊慌的奇怪感觉。

detailed_translations.english: wanting to know about something

sentences.english: He’s only been in this job for nine months.
sentences.chinese: 他干这份工作才九个月。

sentences.english: We open at nine (= nine o’clock ).
sentences.chinese: 我们9点开始营业。

sentences.english: Kay was taught by her mother till she was nine (= nine years old ).
sentences.chinese: 凯一直由她妈妈教到九岁。

detailed_translations.english: the number 9

sentences.english: In that region, Chile went from ninth to first, overall, as Chilean mobile web use increased by 3200% over the past year.
sentences.chinese: 智利从这一地区的第九跃升到第一位，因为智利的移动网络用户在过去一年增长了 3200% 。

sentences.english: The dollar rose by a ninth of a cent.
sentences.chinese: 美元升值了1/9美分

detailed_translations.english: coming after eight other things in a series
one of nine equal parts of something

sentences.english: It was nineteen minutes past seven.
sentences.chinese: 当时是7点19分。

sentences.english: I was only nineteen (= 19 years old ).
sentences.chinese: 我当时只有19岁。

detailed_translations.english: the number 19

sentences.english: The nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezekel.
sentences.chinese: 第十九是毗他希雅，第二十是以西结。

sentences.english: The insurance industry, which emerged in the nineteenth century, required precise knowledge about the risk of loss in order to calculate premiums .
sentences.chinese: 十九世纪产生的保险业，需要精确地知道造成损失的危险程度有多大，以便计算保险费用。

sentences.english: One eof the most famous monuments in the world, the Statue of Liberty, was presented to the United States of America in the nineteenth century by the people of France.
sentences.chinese: 一个世界上最著名的纪念碑，自由女神像，是美国的美国在第十九世纪时由法国人民。

sentences.english: America was far richer in the nineties.
sentences.chinese: 90年代的美国要富裕得多。

detailed_translations.english: the number 90
the number 90

sentences.english: Most of the stores do not open until 10 am.
sentences.chinese: 大多数商店要到上午10点才开始营业。

sentences.english: She’s not a very nice person.
sentences.chinese: 她为人不太好。

sentences.english: You were wrong not to inform the police.
sentences.chinese: 你没有通知警方是错误的。

sentences.english: ‘Can we go to the park?’ ‘No, not today, dear.’
sentences.chinese: “我们能去公园吗？”“不，今天不行，亲爱的。”

detailed_translations.english: used to make a word, statement, or question negative

sentences.english: More or other, they still dissatisfy.
sentences.chinese: 更多或另外一些，它们仍然不满足。

sentences.english: American's unilateralism act in fighting terrorism and its expansion tendency dissatisfy American's allied countries.
sentences.chinese: 第三，美国反恐中的“单边主义”行为和扩大化倾向令盟国极为不满。

sentences.english: Are your dissatisfy actions related to the content of your work your company culture or the people with whom you work?
sentences.chinese: 你不满意的是你工作的内容，公司文化，还是公司同事呢？

detailed_translations.english: to fail to satisfy; disappoint

sentences.english: an unwilling helper
sentences.chinese: 勉强来帮忙的人

detailed_translations.english: not wanting to do something and refusing to do it

sentences.english: Why do you dislike her so much?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么那么讨厌她？

sentences.english: My dislike of thunder and even small earthquakes was due to Mother.
sentences.chinese: 我对雷声甚至于轻微地震的厌恶都归因于我的母亲。

detailed_translations.english: to think someone or something is unpleasant and not like them
Dislike is the feeling that you do not like someone or something

sentences.english: Barr strongly disagreed with Kronfeld’s statement.
sentences.chinese: 巴尔强烈反对克龙费尔德的说法。

sentences.english: The statements of several witnesses disagree.
sentences.chinese: 几名证人的证词不一致。

detailed_translations.english: to have or express a different opinion from someone else

sentences.english: Damien has always had a healthy disrespect (= that you think is good ) for media opinion.
sentences.chinese: 达米安对媒体的观点从来都持合理的不以为然的态度。

sentences.english: It was said on the spur of the moment and I meant no disrespect to anybody.
sentences.chinese: 我一时冲口而出，无意冒犯任何人。

sentences.english: No disrespect to Phil, but the team has performed better since he left (= used to show you are not criticizing someone ) .
sentences.chinese: 我无意对菲尔不敬，不过自从他离开后球队表现更好了。

detailed_translations.english: lack of respect for someone or something

sentences.english: his niece, the daughter of his eldest sister
sentences.chinese: 他的外甥女，他大姐的女儿

detailed_translations.english: the daughter of your brother or sister, or the daughter of your wife’s or husband’s brother or sister

sentences.english: Nothing ever happens in this town.
sentences.chinese: 这镇上从来都不会发生什么特别的事。

sentences.english: There’s nothing in this box.
sentences.chinese: 这盒子里什么也没有。

sentences.english: There was nothing else the doctors could do.
sentences.chinese: 医生们没有别的办法了。

sentences.english: He had nothing more to say.
sentences.chinese: 他没有更多要说的了。

sentences.english: We know nothing about her family.
sentences.chinese: 我们对她的家庭一无所知。

sentences.english: I couldn’t just stand by and do nothing.
sentences.chinese: 我不能就那样袖手旁观。

sentences.english: I promised to say nothing about it to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 我答应这件事对谁也不说。

sentences.english: We’ve heard nothing from her for weeks.
sentences.chinese: 我们好几个星期没有她的音信了。

sentences.english: There’s absolutely nothing to be ashamed of.
sentences.chinese: 根本没有什么好难为情的。

sentences.english: ‘Do you know much about business?’ ‘Nothing at all.’
sentences.chinese: “你对做生意了解得多吗？”“一窍不通。”

sentences.english: She had eaten virtually nothing at supper.
sentences.chinese: 晚饭她几乎什么也没吃。

sentences.english: There’s nothing wrong with the data.
sentences.chinese: 这些数据没什么差错。

sentences.english: There’s nothing new about this.
sentences.chinese: 这没有什么新鲜的。

sentences.english: A brief search was made but they found nothing untoward.
sentences.chinese: 他们简单地搜查了一番，没发现任何异常。

sentences.english: She’s nothing like her brother.
sentences.chinese: 她一点都不像她的哥哥。

detailed_translations.english: not anything or no thing
to have no qualities or features that are similar to someone or something else

sentences.english: He’s never been to Australia.
sentences.chinese: 他从未去过澳大利亚。

sentences.english: I’m never going back there again, not as long as I live.
sentences.chinese: 只要我活着，我再也不会回到那儿去。

sentences.english: It is never too late to give up smoking.
sentences.chinese: 戒烟不言晚。

sentences.english: (= never after a particular time ) would he return to Naples.
sentences.chinese: 他再也不会回到那不勒斯。

detailed_translations.english: not at any time, or not once

sentences.english: I want a mountain, a real one. In the Netherlands.
sentences.chinese: 我想要一个山峰，一个荷兰的真正的山。

sentences.english: He rendered the landscapes of the Netherlands with great skill and artistry.
sentences.chinese: 他以高度技巧和艺术才能描绘了荷兰的风景。

sentences.english: Weeks later it wiped out fields in the Netherlands, Germany, Denmark and England.
sentences.chinese: 几周以后它彻底横扫了荷兰、德国、丹麦和英格兰的田野。

sentences.english: We’ve had a long period of low rainfall.
sentences.chinese: 我们已有很长一段时间雨量偏低。

sentences.english: The city has received only half its average rainfall of four inches.
sentences.chinese: 该市目前的降雨只有往常四英寸平均雨量的一半。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of rain that falls on an area in a particular period of time

sentences.english: Let's sit down and take a rest for a while.
sentences.chinese: 我们坐下来，少憩片刻吧。

sentences.english: They should sit down to talk out their differences.
sentences.chinese: 他们应该坐下来通过商谈来消除他们之间的分歧。

sentences.english: They were asked to sit down together and hash out their differences by their father.
sentences.chinese: 父亲让他们坐下来好好讨论一下他们之间的分歧所在。

detailed_translations.english: to adopt or cause (oneself or another) to adopt a sitting posture

sentences.english: I knocked on the door but nobody answered.
sentences.chinese: 我敲了敲门，但没人应门。

detailed_translations.english: no one

sentences.english: Nowhere is drug abuse more of a problem than in the US.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么地方的吸毒问题比美国更严重。

detailed_translations.english: not in any place or to any place

sentences.english: They must have returned by another route.
sentences.chinese: 他们肯定是从另一条路线回来的。

detailed_translations.english: not the same thing, person etc, but a different one

sentences.english: I still haven’t finished painting the spare room.
sentences.chinese: 我还没粉刷完那间空房间。

sentences.english: Do you still have Julie’s phone number?
sentences.chinese: 你还留着朱莉的电话号码吗？

detailed_translations.english: up to a particular point in time and continuing at that moment

detailed_translations.chinese: 静止的，不动的；寂静的，平静的；不起泡的
detailed_translations.english: not moving
a photograph of a scene from a film

detailed_translations.chinese: 蒸馏；使…静止；使…平静下来

sentences.english: They once again held out on him when he asked to leave the army.
sentences.chinese: 他退伍的要求再一次遭到了拒绝。

sentences.english: Which way is north?
sentences.chinese: 哪边是北？

sentences.english: He lives in North Wales.
sentences.chinese: 他住在威尔士北部。

detailed_translations.english: the direction that is at the top of a map of the world, above the Equator. It is on the left if you are facing the rising sun
in the north or facing the north

sentences.english: a man with a northern accent
sentences.chinese: 带有北方口音的男子

sentences.english: Northern Europe
sentences.chinese: 北欧

detailed_translations.english: in or from the north of a country or area

sentences.english: A normal working week is 40 hours.
sentences.chinese: 一个正常的工作周是40小时。

sentences.english: She was assessed in the normal way, and placed on the waiting list.
sentences.chinese: 她接受了正常的评估后被列入等候名单。

sentences.english: All I want is to lead a normal life.
sentences.chinese: 我想要的只是能过正常的生活。

detailed_translations.english: usual, typical, or expected

sentences.english: The company holds regular meetings with employees.
sentences.chinese: 公司定期召集雇员开会。

sentences.english: His breathing was slow and regular.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸缓慢而均匀。

sentences.english: Trains will run at regular intervals from 11 am to 4 pm.
sentences.chinese: 火车从上午11点到下午4点每隔一定时间开行。

sentences.english: We hear from him on a regular basis .
sentences.chinese: 我们定期收到他的来信。

sentences.english: He phones us every Sunday at six, regular as clockwork (= always at the same time ) .
sentences.chinese: 他每逢星期天6点钟打电话给我们，非常准时。

sentences.english: a regular job
sentences.chinese: 固定的工作

detailed_translations.english: happening every hour, every week, every month etc, usually with the same amount of time in between

sentences.english: Sweden borders Norway and Finland.
sentences.chinese: 瑞典与挪威、芬兰接壤。

sentences.english: We come from Norway.
sentences.chinese: 我们来自挪威。

sentences.english: They tried to chart the sea area between Norway and Denmark.
sentences.chinese: 他们企图绘制挪威与丹麦之间的海域图。

sentences.english: Lifeguards are trained to deal with emergencies.
sentences.chinese: 救生员接受过应对紧急情况的训练。

sentences.english: (= In case of emergency ), press the alarm button.
sentences.chinese: 遇到紧急情况，请按报警按钮。

sentences.english: The plane had to make an emergency landing.
sentences.chinese: 那架飞机不得不紧急着陆。

sentences.english: The government called an emergency meeting to discuss the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 政府召开了紧急会议，讨论这次危机。

detailed_translations.english: an unexpected and dangerous situation that must be dealt with immediately

sentences.english: Copy this page in your notebook.
sentences.chinese: 把这一页抄到你的笔记本上。

sentences.english: She rummaged in the desk drawers for her notebook.
sentences.chinese: 她在书桌抽屉里翻找她的笔记本。

sentences.english: She immediately copied the letter in her notebook.
sentences.chinese: 她立即把这封信抄在她的笔记本里。

detailed_translations.english: a book made of plain paper on which you can write notes

sentences.english: The booklet provides all the necessary information about the college.
sentences.chinese: 这本小册子提供了关于那所学院的所有必需信息。

sentences.english: No further changes were considered necessary.
sentences.chinese: 没有必要作出进一步改变。

sentences.english: The doctor says it may be necessary for me to have an operation.
sentences.chinese: 医生说我可能需要做手术。

sentences.english: The closure of the factory was a necessary consequence of increased competition from abroad.
sentences.chinese: 工厂倒闭是来自国外的竞争加剧的必然结果。

detailed_translations.english: something that is necessary is what you need to have or need to do

sentences.english: The care of old people necessarily involves quite a lot of heavy lifting.
sentences.chinese: 照顾老年人必定要干很多搬重物的活儿。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that cannot be different or be avoided

sentences.english: I’m afraid it’s become a matter of economic necessity.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕这已成了一个经济需求的问题。

detailed_translations.english: when something is necessary

sentences.english: And again in November.
sentences.chinese: 在十一月又一次。

sentences.english: Too much snow in November.
sentences.chinese: 太多的大雪在十一月。

detailed_translations.english: the 11th month of the year, between October and December

sentences.english: Make x greater than or equal to zero.
sentences.chinese: 设x大于或等于零。

detailed_translations.english: the number 0
the number 0

sentences.english: They wrote various numbers on a large sheet of paper.
sentences.chinese: 他们在一张大纸上写下了很多不同的数字。

sentences.english: Add all the numbers together.
sentences.chinese: 把所有数字加起来。

sentences.english: Answer question number 4.
sentences.chinese: 回答第4题。

detailed_translations.english: a word or sign that represents an amount or a quantity

sentences.english: She's a widow now.
sentences.chinese: 她现在是一个寡妇。

sentences.english: But we are now a much more fragmented society.
sentences.chinese: 但是我们现在是一个更加四分五裂的社会。

sentences.english: If we leave now we’ll be there before dark.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们现在出发，天黑之前就能赶到那里。

detailed_translations.english: (at) the present time

sentences.english: He’s merely a boy – you can’t expect him to understand.
sentences.chinese: 他只是个孩子——你不要指望他能理解。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize how small or unimportant something or someone is

sentences.english: The shop’s daily profit is usually around $500.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店每天的利润一般在500美元左右。

sentences.english: She sold the business and bought a farm with the profits.
sentences.chinese: 她卖了公司，用所得利润买下了一座农场。

sentences.english: They sold their house at a healthy profit.
sentences.chinese: 他们卖掉房子，赚了一大笔钱。

sentences.english: There’s no profit in letting meetings drag on.
sentences.chinese: 会议拖拖拉拉没什么好处。

detailed_translations.english: money that you gain by selling things or doing business, after your costs have been paid
to get money from doing something

sentences.english: useful information
sentences.chinese: 有用的信息

sentences.english: A little Japanese can be really useful.
sentences.chinese: 懂一点日语非常有用。

sentences.english: Can you come and make yourself useful(= help people to do something )?
sentences.chinese: 你能不能过来帮点忙？

detailed_translations.chinese: 有用的，有益的；有帮助的
detailed_translations.english: helping you to do or get what you want

sentences.english: As a commuter service, the ferry has outlived its usefulness(= is no longer useful ).
sentences.chinese: 作为一种通勤服务，渡船已经没有用武之地了。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being useful or the degree to which something is useful

sentences.english: The editor killed a few useless lines.
sentences.chinese: 编辑删掉了几行无用的文字。

sentences.english: Please cancel the words which are useless.
sentences.chinese: 请把无用的词划掉。

sentences.english: They wrote his suggestion off as a useless idea.
sentences.chinese: 他们把他的建议看做是无用的想法。

sentences.english: Maurice asked me whether I needed any help.
sentences.chinese: 莫里斯问我是否需要帮助。

sentences.english: There were times when I wondered whether or not we would get there.
sentences.chinese: 有时候我也想知道我们能不能做得到。

sentences.english: I didn’t know whether to believe him or not.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道该不该相信他。

sentences.english: The question arose as to whether this behaviour was unlawful.
sentences.chinese: 问题出现了: 这种行为是否不合法？

detailed_translations.english: used when talking about a choice you have to make or about something that is not certain

sentences.english: I like it at the top of my file.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢把它放到我文件的顶端。

sentences.english: This one should be at the top of your list.
sentences.chinese: 这一项应该在列表的顶端。

sentences.english: These issues should clearly be at the top of the priority list.
sentences.chinese: 这些问题应该在这个优先列表的顶部就不澄清。

sentences.english: the upper lip
sentences.chinese: 上唇

detailed_translations.english: in a higher position than something else

sentences.english: Nearly 10% of the Earth’s surface is covered by ice.
sentences.chinese: 地球表面将近 10% 被冰层覆盖。

sentences.english: Gas bubbles in any liquid tend to rise to the surface .
sentences.chinese: 在任何液体中气泡往往都会浮到表面。

detailed_translations.english: the top layer of an area of water or land
relating to the part of the army, navy etc that travels by land or on the sea, rather than by air or under the sea
if someone or something surfaces, they suddenly appear somewhere, especially after being gone or hidden for a long time

sentences.english: a low wooden table with a glass top
sentences.chinese: 玻璃桌面的矮木桌

detailed_translations.chinese: 顶部，顶端；上部；首席；陀螺
detailed_translations.english: the highest part of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 高出，超越；结束；达到顶点
detailed_translations.english: to be higher than a particular amount
nearest to the top of something

sentences.english: Although in poor health, she continued to carry out her duties.
sentences.chinese: 尽管身体不好，她仍继续执行任务。

sentences.english: We decided to take rooms in Longwood House, although we knew we could not really afford the rent.
sentences.chinese: 虽然我们知道自己其实付不起租金，但还是决定住朗伍德庄园的房间。

sentences.english: Although I can’t help admiring the man’s courage, I do not approve of his methods.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我不得不佩服那个男子的勇气，却并不赞成他的方法。

detailed_translations.english: used to introduce a statement that makes your main statement seem surprising or unlikely

sentences.english: Shall we go out to the cinema or stay at home?
sentences.chinese: 我们是出去看电影还是待在家里？

sentences.english: You can have ham, cheese, or tuna.
sentences.chinese: 你可以选择火腿、干酪或者金枪鱼。

sentences.english: She wasn’t involved in drugs or anything like that.
sentences.chinese: 她没有涉毒之类的行为。

sentences.english: Grapes are usually either green or red.
sentences.chinese: 葡萄一般要么是绿色，要么是红色。

sentences.english: He’s going to do it whether we like it or not.
sentences.chinese: 不管我们喜欢与否，他都会去做这件事。

sentences.english: It’s going to snow tomorrow, or that’s what the forecast says.
sentences.chinese: 明天要下雪，确切地说，气象预报是这样说的。

detailed_translations.english: used between two words or phrases to show that either of two things is possible, or used before the last in a list of possibilities or choices

sentences.english: a pot of soup simmering on the stove
sentences.chinese: 在炉灶上煨着的一锅汤

sentences.english: a wood-burning stove
sentences.chinese: 烧木柴的火炉

detailed_translations.english: a piece of kitchen equipment on which you cook food in pots and pans, and that contains an oven

sentences.english: He threw the door open and ran down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 他猛地打开门，往楼下跑去。

sentences.english: an open window
sentences.chinese: 打开的窗户

sentences.english: The gates swung silently open.
sentences.chinese: 大门悄悄地打开了。

sentences.english: The bar door flew open and a noisy group burst in.
sentences.chinese: 酒吧的门猛地弹开，冲进来一群吵吵闹闹的人。

sentences.english: All the windows were wide open (= completely open ).
sentences.chinese: 所有的窗户都大开着。

sentences.english: The museum is open daily in the summer months.
sentences.chinese: 夏季里这座博物馆每天开放。

sentences.english: Jack opened the window.
sentences.chinese: 杰克打开窗户。

detailed_translations.english: not closed, so that things, people, air etc can go in and out or be put in and out
to move a door, window etc so that people, things, air etc can pass through, or to be moved in this way

sentences.english: We’re obviously going to need more help.
sentences.chinese: 显然我们将需要更多的帮助。

sentences.english: Your research has obviously been very thorough.
sentences.chinese: 你的研究工作显然做得很透彻。

sentences.english: Obviously, this is going to take some time.
sentences.chinese: 很明显，这要花点时间。

sentences.english: Cost is obviously important.
sentences.chinese: 费用当然很重要。

sentences.english: She frowned and was obviously puzzled.
sentences.chinese: 她皱起眉头，显然感到不解。

detailed_translations.english: used to mean that a fact can easily be noticed or understood

sentences.english: We have to show that publishing this story is in the public interest (= helpful or useful to ordinary people ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们必须证明刊登这篇报道有利于公众。

sentences.english: full public access to information
sentences.chinese: 公众对信息的充分知情权

sentences.english: Public opinion is gradually shifting in favor of the imprisoned men.
sentences.chinese: 舆论渐渐倾向于同情入狱的男子。

sentences.english: There was a public outcry (= expression of anger by a lot of people ) about the shooting.
sentences.chinese: 公众就枪击事件发出了强烈抗议。

sentences.english: Their activities have been hidden from the public gaze (= people’s eyes or attention ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的活动一直在避开公众的视线。

sentences.english: He is adored by his public.
sentences.chinese: 他深受支持者喜爱。

detailed_translations.english: relating to all the ordinary people in a country, who are not members of the government or do not have important jobs
ordinary people who do not work for the government or have any special position in society

sentences.english: She often works at the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 她周末经常要上班。

sentences.english: If you wash your hair too often, it can get too dry.
sentences.chinese: 如果洗头过勤，头发会变得干枯。

sentences.english: How often do you see your parents?
sentences.chinese: 你隔多久去看你父母？

sentences.english: Robin is a difficult child; you’ve said so yourself often enough (= a lot of times ).
sentences.chinese: 罗宾是个难管的孩子，你自己也常常这么说。

detailed_translations.english: if something happens often, it happens regularly or many times

sentences.english: After the storm we were without electricity for five days.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨之后我们断电了五天。

sentences.english: a house without a garden
sentences.chinese: 不带花园的房子

sentences.english: We passed two ruined abbeys, one with a tower and one without.
sentences.chinese: 我们路过两座破落的寺院，一座有塔楼，另一座没有。

sentences.english: I’m getting used to managing without a car.
sentences.chinese: 我已经习惯没有汽车了。

detailed_translations.english: not having something, especially something that is basic or necessary

detailed_translations.chinese: 户外；在外面；没有或不显示某事物

sentences.english: Many U.S. cities now have nonstop flights to Aspen.
sentences.chinese: 很多美国城市现在都有飞往亚斯本的直飞航班。

sentences.english: ...80 minutes of nonstop music.
sentences.chinese: …80分钟不间断的音乐。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is nonstop continues without any pauses or interruptions

sentences.english: Annie led a quiet uneventful life.
sentences.chinese: 安妮过着安静平淡的生活。

sentences.english: The journey was uneventful.
sentences.chinese: 旅途平平淡淡。

detailed_translations.chinese: 平凡的； 平安无事的
detailed_translations.english: with nothing exciting or unusual happening

sentences.english: Doubtless there would be lots of rumours.
sentences.chinese: 无疑会谣言四起。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无疑地；确定地；大概，多半
detailed_translations.english: used when saying that something is almost certain to happen or be true

sentences.english: She gave a faint smile.
sentences.chinese: 她淡淡一笑。

sentences.english: a very faint noise
sentences.chinese: 很微弱的声响

sentences.english: the faint light of dawn
sentences.chinese: 微弱的晨光

detailed_translations.chinese: 模糊的；头晕的；虚弱的；[医] 衰弱的
detailed_translations.english: difficult to see, hear, smell etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 昏倒；变得微弱；变得没气力
detailed_translations.english: to suddenly become unconscious for a short time
an act of becoming unconscious

sentences.english: She tucked her hair behind her ears.
sentences.chinese: 她把头发拢到耳朵背后。

detailed_translations.english: one of the organs on either side of your head that you hear with

sentences.english: Most seasonal hiring is done in early October.
sentences.chinese: 多数季节性招聘是在10月初进行。

detailed_translations.english: the tenth month of the year, between September and November

sentences.english: a rise in the price of oil
sentences.chinese: 石油价格的上涨

sentences.english: the importance of protecting our oil supplies
sentences.chinese: 保护我们石油供应的重要性

sentences.english: an oil refinery
sentences.chinese: 炼油厂

sentences.english: The bicycle chain needs oiling.
sentences.chinese: 自行车链条需要上油了。

detailed_translations.english: the thick dark liquid from under the ground from which petrol is produced
to put oil onto part of a machine or part of something that moves, to help it to move or work more smoothly

sentences.english: Lily spent years caring for her sick uncle.
sentences.chinese: 莉莉照顾了她生病的叔叔好多年。

sentences.english: After his parents cashed in, he lived with his uncle.
sentences.chinese: 他在父母去世后，与叔叔在一起过。

sentences.english: When she was orphaned,her uncle sent her to orphanage.
sentences.chinese: 她的父母刚一去世，她的叔叔便把她送进了孤儿院。

detailed_translations.english: used by children, in front of a first name, to address or refer to a man who is a close friend of their parents

sentences.english: The minister stressed the need for economic sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 部长强调了在经济上作出牺牲的必要性。

sentences.english: The workforce were willing to make sacrifices in order to preserve jobs.
sentences.chinese: 雇员为了保住饭碗情愿作出牺牲。

sentences.english: She brought three children up single-handedly, often at great personal sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 她独自一人把三个孩子带大，常常需要作出巨大的个人牺牲。

sentences.english: They made sacrifices to ensure a good harvest.
sentences.chinese: 他们举行献祭以保丰收。

sentences.english: He sacrificed a promising career to look after his kids.
sentences.chinese: 他为了照看孩子牺牲了很有前途的事业。

detailed_translations.english: when you decide not to have something valuable, in order to get something that is more important
to willingly stop having something you want or doing something you like in order to get something more important

sentences.english: orange juice
sentences.chinese: 橙汁

sentences.english: orange peel
sentences.chinese: 橙子皮

sentences.english: Peel the oranges and divide them into segments.
sentences.chinese: 把橙子去皮，然后切成片。

sentences.english: orange groves (= where orange trees grow )
sentences.chinese: 柑橘园

detailed_translations.english: a round fruit that has a thick orange skin and is divided into parts inside

sentences.english: neat handwriting
sentences.chinese: 工整的笔迹

sentences.english: His clothes were always neat and clean.
sentences.chinese: 他的衣服总是很整洁。

sentences.english: Everything in the house was neat and tidy.
sentences.chinese: 房子里的每样物品都干净整齐。

sentences.english: She arranged the books in a nice neat pile.
sentences.chinese: 她把书摞成整齐的一堆。

detailed_translations.english: tidy and carefully arranged

sentences.english: the liver, heart, and other internal organs
sentences.chinese: 肝脏、心脏及其他内脏器官

sentences.english: loss of blood flow to his vital organs
sentences.chinese: 他的生命器官供血不足

sentences.english: Extra doses of the hormone caused the animals’ reproductive organs to develop sooner than usual.
sentences.chinese: 额外使用激素使得这些动物的生殖器官比正常情况下发育得更快。

sentences.english: In Arizona, 480 people are waiting for organ transplants.
sentences.chinese: 亚利桑那州有480人在等待器官移植。

sentences.english: dying people who have agreed to be organ donors
sentences.chinese: 愿意捐献器官的垂死的病人

detailed_translations.english: a part of the body, such as the heart or lungs, that has a particular purpose

sentences.english: The public expect high standards from any large organization.
sentences.chinese: 公众对任何大型机构都期望很高。

sentences.english: the World Trade Organization
sentences.chinese: 世界贸易组织

sentences.english: a voluntary organization which helps disabled people with their transport needs
sentences.chinese: 帮助残疾人士满足其交通需求的一个志愿组织

sentences.english: an illegal terrorist organization
sentences.chinese: 非法的恐怖组织

sentences.english: international organizations such as the UN
sentences.chinese: 诸如联合国之类的国际组织

detailed_translations.english: a group such as a club or business that has formed for a particular purpose

sentences.english: The course was organized by a training company.
sentences.chinese: 这一课程是由一家培训公司组织的。

sentences.english: Students need to learn how to organize their work.
sentences.chinese: 学生要学会如何安排好自己的学习。

sentences.english: We are learning about how genes are organized.
sentences.chinese: 我们在了解基因是如何排列的。

detailed_translations.english: to make the necessary arrangements so that an activity can happen effectively

sentences.english: Her earlier work shows a lot of originality.
sentences.chinese: 她的早期作品显示出丰富的独创性。

sentences.english: A lot of his designs lack originality.
sentences.chinese: 他的很多设计都缺乏创意。

sentences.english: a young writer of great originality
sentences.chinese: 一位极富创意的年轻作家

detailed_translations.chinese: 创意；独创性，创造力；原始；新奇
detailed_translations.english: when something is completely new and different from anything that anyone has thought of before

sentences.english: Make sure you keep the key in a safe place.
sentences.chinese: 一定要把钥匙放在安全的地方。

sentences.english: I’ve spent the day dashing about from place to place.
sentences.chinese: 我这一天尽是在东奔西跑。

sentences.english: The place was full of screaming children.
sentences.chinese: 那地方全是大叫大嚷的孩子们。

sentences.english: He was threatening to burn the place down.
sentences.chinese: 他扬言要把那地方烧毁。

sentences.english: She had never been back to the place where the accident happened.
sentences.chinese: 她再也没回过事故发生的地点。

sentences.english: The theatre bar was our usual meeting place.
sentences.chinese: 这个剧院酒吧是我们见面的老地方。

sentences.english: We were living then in a place called Alberiga.
sentences.chinese: 那时候我们住在一个叫阿尔伯里格的地方。

sentences.english: The wall was quite damp in places (= in some places ) .
sentences.chinese: 墙上有几处很潮湿。

sentences.english: Did the accident happen at your place of work (= the place where you work ) ?
sentences.chinese: 事故是在你的工作地点发生的吗？

sentences.english: It took us ages to find a place to live.
sentences.chinese: 我们花了好长时间才找到一个住处。

detailed_translations.english: a space or area, for example a particular point on a surface or in a room, building, town, city etc

sentences.english: local hospital
sentences.chinese: 当地医院

sentences.english: local residents
sentences.chinese: 本地居民

sentences.english: a local infection
sentences.chinese: 局部感染

detailed_translations.english: relating to the particular area you live in, or the area you are talking about

sentences.english: I live locally, so it’s easy to get to the office.
sentences.chinese: 我就住在附近，所以上班很方便。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在本地, 地方性地, 局部地
detailed_translations.english: in or near the area where you are, or the area you are talking about

sentences.english: on Easter Sunday
sentences.chinese: 在复活节星期日

detailed_translations.english: a Christian holy day in March or April when Christians remember the death of Christ and his return to life

sentences.english: When I began to cough, I blamed it on the Austrian cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 当我开始咳嗽时，我把这事怪在抽奥地利的香烟上。

sentences.english: Austrian euro coins have a unique design for each denomination, with a common theme for each of the three series of coins.
sentences.chinese: 奥地利的欧元硬币对于每个货币的命名有着唯一的设计，三个系列的硬币有着共同的设计主题。

sentences.english: She quotes an Austrian banker as saying: “I always find it easier to do business [in English] with partners from Greece or Russia or Denmark.
sentences.chinese: 她引用了一位奥地利银行家的话称：“我总是发现，（用英语）和希腊、俄罗斯或丹麦人做生意更容易一些。

detailed_translations.english: someone from Austria

detailed_translations.chinese: 奥地利的, 奥地利人的
detailed_translations.english: relating to Austria or its people

sentences.english: the eastern shore of the island
sentences.chinese: 岛的东岸

sentences.english: farmers in eastern England
sentences.chinese: 英格兰东部的农民

sentences.english: Eastern religions
sentences.chinese: 东方宗教

detailed_translations.english: in or from the east of a country or area

sentences.english: She stood on the beach, gazing at the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 她站在海滩上，凝视着大海。

sentences.english: I like to swim in the ocean when it’s warm enough.
sentences.chinese: 海水足够暖的时候，我喜欢在海里游泳。

detailed_translations.chinese: 洋， 海洋； 许多， 大量
detailed_translations.english: the great mass of salt water that covers most of the Earth’s surface

sentences.english: I forgot to pack my razor.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记把剃须刀放入行李包了。

sentences.english: Hundreds of people packed into the mosque.
sentences.chinese: 成百上千的人挤进了清真寺。

sentences.english: Send away for your free information pack today.
sentences.chinese: 今天就来函索取免费资料包吧。

detailed_translations.english: to put things into cases, bags etc ready for a trip somewhere
something wrapped in paper or packed in a box and then sent by post or taken somewhere

sentences.english: There’s a package here for a Miami Lakes address.
sentences.chinese: 这里有一个寄往迈阿密湖的包裹。

detailed_translations.english: something wrapped in paper, packed in a box, and then sent by mail or delivered
to put food or other goods into a bag, box etc ready to be sold or sent

sentences.english: The parcel was delivered last week.
sentences.chinese: 那个邮包上周送到了。

sentences.english: He sends regular food parcels to his family in Libya.
sentences.chinese: 他定期给在利比亚的家人邮寄食品包裹。

detailed_translations.english: an object that has been wrapped in paper or put in a special envelope, especially so that it can be sent by post

sentences.english: I’ll get you a piece of paper so you can write the number down.
sentences.chinese: 我给你找张纸，你好把号码写下来。

sentences.english: Do you have a pen and paper?
sentences.chinese: 你有笔和纸吗？

sentences.english: the 1998 White Paper on political reform
sentences.chinese: 1998年政治改革白皮书

sentences.english: a paper on the Civil War
sentences.chinese: 一篇关于南北战争的论文

detailed_translations.english: material in the form of thin sheets that is used for writing on, wrapping things etc

sentences.english: Let’s go for a walk in the park.
sentences.chinese: 我们去公园散步吧。

sentences.english: a park bench
sentences.chinese: 公园长椅

sentences.english: a flat overlooking Hyde Park
sentences.chinese: 一套可以俯瞰海德公园的公寓

detailed_translations.english: a large open area with grass and trees, especially in a town, where people can walk, play games etc

sentences.english: They demanded a free parliament and press.
sentences.chinese: 他们要求议会自由和新闻自由。

detailed_translations.english: the group of people who are elected to make a country’s laws and discuss important national affairs

sentences.english: We’re having a small party this evening to celebrate our wedding anniversary.

sentences.chinese: 轮船及时转向，避免了一次事故。

sentences.chinese: 他经常要发表席后演说。
